Are you interested in joining the dream team at Wesfarmers OneDigital?
Good call. We’re an exciting new digital enterprise with big ideas, supporting some of Australia’s most trusted and iconic brands focussed on making lives better for people all around Australia. We’re well on our way towards bringing the best of digital and data possibilities together to create more personalised shopping experiences for customers across our retail brands. Why? Because we want to make life more effortless for all Australians.
We’re continuing to bring the best talent and skills under one roof, working together and across disciplines to build amazing experiences for our customers. We continuously feed off each other’s insights, talents and capabilities, because we are a business that thrives on open collaboration and a shared vision of positive, fun and rewarding experiences.

Your Chapter Purpose
With plans to transform the Australian retail and industrial landscape, comes a big responsibility. We see a future where we are leaders in the data and digital space. It’s why we’ve been working hard to accelerate the development of data, digital and analytics capabilities across our businesses. We’re focused on harnessing the power of data and transforming it into meaningful insights that enhance our customer experience, strengthen our businesses, and help them pursue new growth opportunities. Our talented and agile team co-create and solve complex problems. It’s innovation, to create better experiences for our customers. It’s adding real value, that supports decision making across the Wesfarmers Group, and its transformational work, that’ll change the industries we operate in.

What you’ll be doing
Understand and interpret retail business needs and translate in to appropriate analytical methodologies whose outputs deliver the desired business benefits and outcomes
Divisional, OneData and External Partner management
Identify the key actionable insights from advanced analytics and translate into clear business relevant recommendations including supporting the activation through pilots and productionised roll-out.
Apply appropriate leading practice analytical methods and techniques in an agile, pragmatic way that reflects the needs, constraints and KPIs of the business (e.g. time, cost, quality, data availability).
Create business enthusiasm and demand for the use of Advanced Analytics through the effective communication and translation of advanced analytical techniques into commercial concepts that can be easily understood by business end users.
Deliver a seamless, and proactive service to stakeholders through the effective articulation of the customer opportunity, commercial benefit, analytical findings and data driven insight recommendations. Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics based decision making.
Research and apply new Advanced Analytics opportunities in areas of prediction, regression, machine learning, and broader Artificial Intelligence applications in the identification and realisation of new opportunities for the business.

To shine on day one, what you need to have:
Ability to visually present modelling outputs, insights, and findings for technical and non-technical audiences
Analytics professional with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in advanced analytics positions, and a total of 5 years’ experience in data-related roles
Track record in designing and delivering data driven actionable solutions
Knowledge and understanding of statistical and machine learning modelling concepts and processes such as, dimension reduction, hyperparameter tuning, feature selection, data sampling, and model evaluation
Experience implementing statistical and machine learning models such as GLM, Time Series Modelling, Neural Networks, Decision Tree Ensemble Methods, Clustering etc.

Reports to:
Head of Data Science and Data Engineering

Why OneDigital?
Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things.
You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life.
Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam
Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed.
We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.

Team Benefits – just to name a few!
To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include:
Access to the latest technologies
An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more)
Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days
Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly
People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small
Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards

Next steps
If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst with State Government. The Senior Data Analyst role undertakes complex technical activities and projects related to data linkage and integration. This includes providing technical linkage services to develop and maintain the Victorian Linkage Map of 35 plus datasets and supporting the enduring data linkage program for the Department. The role also responds to linkage requests from government and researchers and provides technical support to national linked data projects
Accountabilities
Undertake multiple projects and requests for data linkage or integration, ensuring completion within timelines to a high standard.
Build and maintain effective working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, including policy and program areas, academic researchers and other government departments.
Provide expert input to projects to improve the quality and effectiveness of data linkage and integration processes, and access to and usability of the de-identified linked data resource.
Produce high quality documentation to communicate data linkage processes and the results of linked data analysis to a range of audiences
Establish and maintain effective working relationships across the department and work in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Provide expert advice on the quality, accuracy and relevance of data for data linkage purposes, to support research, policy development, program development, and evaluation.
Keep accurate and complete records of your work activities in accordance with legislative requirements and the department's records, information security and privacy policies and requirements.
Demonstrate how the actions and outcomes of this role and work unit impact clients and the department's ability to deliver, or facilitate the delivery of, effective support and services.
Key selection criteria
Technical expertise
Workplace experience and advanced skills in the management and analysis of large administrative and/or clinical datasets
Experience in in working with personally identifiable information (e.g., names, addresses, SLK) and applying deterministic and/or probabilistic data linkage methodologies
Advanced skills in Python, with experience using Pyspark functionality highly desired.
Exposure to the Microsoft Azure data science environment, particularly Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks, would be advantageous.
HOW TO APPLY:
Please submit your resume (in MS Word Format) for consideration via the link below. A cover letter demonstrating your relevant experience may also be reviewed.
Should you wish to discuss, please contact Neha Agrawal at neha.agrawal@hudson.com , quoting reference number 223921.
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

QinetiQ employs more than 6000 people in 51 locations around the world, offering our customers premier expertise in advice, services and creative technology-based products.

QinetiQ Australia, part of the global QinetiQ group, provides technological and scientific expertise to help customers protect and advance their vital interests. As an innovative science and technology company, we help solve some of our customers' most challenging problems. Our determination to deliver and improve today and anticipate and shape tomorrow, makes QinetiQ a very exciting, rewarding and respected place to work and learn.

QinetiQ is developing at an incredible pace year on year and we’re not slowing down!

This is an exciting phase in our history and we are looking for an experienced Lab Technician , based in Melbourne that will see you working within our Engineering Services division.

You’ll share our values of Performance, Collaboration and Integrity, and our purpose to protect the safety and security of our nation. Joining our talented team, you will be part of a diverse and inclusive environment with an enviable culture which inspires our people to deliver their best work.

As the Lab Technician , your key responsibilities will include, but not limited to;

Preparation of batteries and associated equipment for testing while working within established operating procedures and work instructions

Document test results and data for further analysis by scientists/engineers

Maintenance of test facilities, liaise with engineering and scientific staff as required, prepare hardware and materials, conduct pre-test, checks and post-test clean-up

Assist in preparation of compliance documentation required for the safe operation of the laboratory is in place and current including managing the risks of hazardous chemicals in the workplace

Assist in the preparation and review of risk assessments and process documentation

To be successful in the role of Lab Technician , you will need demonstrated experience, knowledge & skills in the following areas:

Demonstrated experience in laboratory testing with electrical/electronics experience being highly regarded

Ability to interpret and following testing protocols and standards

Good oral and written communication skills including the ability to collate, interpret and report technical information, concepts, procedures and laboratory test results

Understanding of WHS principles relating to testing laboratories

Good aptitude in operating software applications

A tertiary qualification in Science or engineering is highly desirable but not essential or proven electronics/electrical experience in a laboratory testing environment

Candidates will be required to obtain an Australian Government secret clearance which will require Australian citizenship. QinetiQ conducts pre-employment screening, including but not limited to identity verification and police checks, for all preferred candidates

Looking for an Employer with Benefits?

At QinetiQ, our competitive remuneration and benefits package supports your evolving needs throughout your career. You’ll share in the company’s success, and be rewarded for your own. We’ll invest in your professional development and provide an inclusive environment for you to succeed.

Some of our benefits include:
Individual Professional development allowance

Flexible work

Purchased leave program & loyalty leave

Up to 18 weeks paid parental leave

Annual incentive scheme

Complimentary salary continuance insurance

Annual volunteering leave with Operation Give Back

Relaxed dress code

A full list of our employee benefits can be found here: https://www.qinetiq.com/en-au/careers/benefits

BMS is seeking a Senior Manager Channel Operations who will develop and execute tools and systems that support multichannel customer engagement, accelerate our insights and enable our sales teams to be more competitive.
Responsibilities

GroupM is the leading global media investment management company serving as the parent to WPP media agencies including Mindshare, Wavemaker and Essence MediaCom, as well as the programmatic digital media platform, Xaxis, each global operation in their own right with leading market positions. With 800+ people based in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide and Brisbane, GroupM’s primary purpose is to maximize performance of WPP’s media agencies by operating as leader and collaborator in trading, content creation, sports, digital, finance, proprietary tool development and other business-critical capabilities. GroupM’s focus is to deliver unrivalled marketplace advantage to its clients, stakeholders and people.
The Data & Tech team at GroupM always have their finger on the pulse, market trends, customer insights and the most up to date know-how on all things data & technology with respect to advertising and identity. The team leverage these skills and attributes to provide A+ service and leadership to our agency partners and client leads.

YOUR ROLE IN A NUTSHELL:
Data Engineering at GroupM is about supporting the development and deployment of GroupM products and services across multiple cloud environments & platforms. The Data Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams of client leads, product leads, consultants and data analyst to translate complex product requirements into technical specs and design requirements. You will build pipelines, optimize performance and build automated solutions whilst maintaining a high degree of knowledge in cloud data architecture and ETL best practices especially across Google Cloud Platform products and services.
You will be responsible for bringing together data, creativity and multiple methods to help our stakeholders make better choices rooted in human insights. All our people, processes and technology are united through our focus on understanding, accelerating and optimizing the current offerings, making them more satisfying for stakeholders and more effective for our clients.

REPORTING OF THE ROLE:
Data Science & Technology Automation, Director

WHAT YOU SHOULD SPEND YOUR TIME DOING:
In order for the business to work, you will be required to spend time in certain areas of the business and make sure your stakeholders are aligned. In addition, you will be the subject matter on all things Data Engineering & Analysis in the Data & Tech team. Your key responsibilities are as follows:
Product
Develop new processes and applications to automate repetitive tasks
Support the Data & Tech team in building custom solutions, delivering key projects and BAU operations, with respect to data engineering, analysis and models.
Design, build and deploy business intelligence dashboards and reporting solutions that increase efficiencies in reporting requirements
Build data pipes landing large files into GCP/AWS for processing, developing/ cleansing data for reporting, automation & AI/ML purposes.
Implement ETL data processing procedures where applicable
Monitor infrastructure performance and optimise where necessary
Performing regular data health checks to ensure data quality and completeness is adhered
Ensure all works are being done in line with company and industry compliance standards
Working on multiple projects involving various stages of the product life cycle
Participate in R&D of projects and contribute to the innovation of new methods (Data Architecture, data profiling tools, ETL and data management tools etc.)

Partnership
Liaising with third party vendors, platforms and outsourcing partners, as appropriate for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Collaboration with external technology vendors e.g., publishers, DSPs, SSP’s, ad tech vendors etc for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Interface and knowledge transfer between Commercial, Ops, Product and Analytics departments
When required, collaborate with any regional and APAC WPP counterparts for economies of scale, knowledge share and any relevant technical streams

People
Demonstrate good communication & presentation skills across all facets of your work
Respond well to guidance and feedback from internal & external stakeholders
Work collaboratively with Data & tech team members and wider GroupM teams

Performance
Ensure discretion and prioritisation is given to either supporting 100% commercial initiatives and/or time saving initiatives
Work collaboratively with stakeholders in ensuring complex technical solutions are demystified and clearly understood
Effectively and succinctly communicate risks in a timely manner, where applicable with suggested mitigation plan
Deliver technical products and solutions on time, and within specification agreed upon by stakeholders involved
Ensure a sound, reliable, ethical and robust governance framework is functioning effectively in line with WPP/GroupM policies and compliance requirements

WHAT IT TAKES
Degree in a relevant field (Statistics/ Mathematics/Computer Science/Economics/Data Analytics)
Previous experience in an engineering/analytical role (0-3yrs), ideally within AdTech/Martech but not mandatory
A hunger to learn and specialise your skillset with an amazing team
Flexibility to work in a cross-functional team but also have the initiative to solve the problem independently
Initiative is key, this role will need a “let me figure this out” attitude rather than “tell me what to do attitude”
Hands on experience in integrating multiple technologies to bring products to life
Ability to balance deadlines with an eye for detail and passion for quality

EXPERIENCE:
The Data Engineer will support the Data & Tech team for all things Data Engineering. They will have exceptional interpersonal skills, being able to communicate complex issues in an easy to digest format. In addition, have strong business acumen & technical skills to ensure GroupM retains and improves its competitive advantage when it comes to data, technology & automation.

COMPETENCIES:
Mastery with Python to work with big data
Strong expertise with Data Architecture fundamentals, database design and programming, ETL and custom query development.
Experience with the following GCP Services: Cloud Storage, DataProc, Dataflow, CloudSQL, BigQuery, Cloud Functions.
A strong understanding of database structures and data mining, being proficient with SQL across multiple database platforms (MySQL, SQL Server etc)
Experience in utilising a version control system (GIT/TFS) and project tracking system (Jira/AzureDevOps)
Proficient with project and product management delivery methodologies and software e.g. JIRA, confluence, Microsoft Project, Asana etc
Strong expertise of BI platforms (DataStudio/Tableau/Datorama/Power BI)
Experience working with API’s

About the company
Scaling start up within the data science space, building software for the best traders in the world using a wide range of technologies such as predictive modelling, real-time analytic dashboards and web3.

Skills and Experience
We are seeking diligent Data Scientist, with experience using:
Python
AWS
SQL
ML Research
Experience in Research
Stats / Math Degree
About you:
An interest in financial data science
Competence with common Python data science libraries (Python notebooks, Pandas, Numpy, Skikkit-learn)
Data Science modelling from scratch

Benefits include
Paid training and accreditation with large budgets in place to help you grown within your career.
Choice of working in the office or remotely (even overseas if you feel like getting away from the Melbourne weather!)
Very flexible working hours and arrangements
Central CBD co-shared office with some amazing perks such as free breakfast, events, drinks & company UberEATS account.
Offsite events and optional interstate trips

Description
Graduate Consultant 2023 - positions across Melbourne, Sydney, and Brisbane
Join the IQ Group Graduate Consultant program and get your career off to a flying start!
You will be part of a team working with our clients and other consultants to deliver change within the Superannuation and Wealth industry. You get to be at the forefront of a dynamic and challenging industry, delivering value to organisations and their customers. This is a time of large-scale growth and change in our industry. The IQ Group provides a unique program and the opportunity for you to grow and develop your skills and future career path.
What work does a Graduate Consultant get involved with? As a graduate consultant the best part is the variety of work. You could be working on a strategy approach, documenting business requirements, implementation and testing of a new system, process re-engineering or documenting customer experiences or data remediation. You will be applying agile and human centred design principles to your work and could even be working on how best to plan the change management of an initiative.
We are looking for people who have graduated within the last 2 years or will finish study in late 2022 from related disciplines in Business & Economics, Information Technology/Computer Science and Data Analytics with Australian work rights. Key skills we look for are attention to detail, focus on data analysis, critical thinking, relationship building and a collaborative approach.
What our Graduate Consultant Program offers:
A 12-month structured program including an initial intensive boot camp
Industry recognised qualifications and ongoing professional development
The opportunity to experience all aspects of project delivery
Formal mentoring by a Principal Consultant
Great exposure to a variety of work environments and a network of professionals within the industry
Valuable experience on a wide range of engagements working with a great IQ Group team and clients
A supportive and values driven team culture
Competitive reward and employee offering

How to apply?

Please apply via LinkedIn and include a cover letter regarding why you are interested in our Graduate Consultant program
From there we review your applications quickly and our resourcing team will be in contact with those who progress to our interview stages. You will have interviews with some of our Principal Consultants and Executive Team. Depending on restrictions we will do this face to face or via video conferencing. We aim to have offers made by end of September with the program starting in early February 2023.

WHAT ON EARTH IS DECIEM?
Known as “The Abnormal Beauty Company”, DECIEM is the parent company of The Ordinary, NIOD, Avestan, and other beauty brands & is an industry disruptor with a science-first approach to innovation. DECIEM was Co-Founded in 2013 by the late Brandon Truaxe, a visionary who set out to change the beauty industry through authenticity and transparency. He developed DECIEM to be a happy family (of people and beauty brands), rooted in kindness, creativity, diversity, and respect, alongside Co-Founder and CEO, Nicola Kilner.
We are growing rapidly and we’re looking for someone who shares this vision and wants to grow with us!
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Reporting to Sr. Demand Planning Manager, you will support our exponential sales growth by promoting product availability at the right time and the right point in the supply network. The Sr. Demand Planner will champion the regional monthly consensus cycle with the objective of completing the rolling consensus forecast and will look at POS & shipment trends, seasonality, future promotion plan, expansion, new product launch, cannibalization, and delists.
This is a hybrid role, working from our Port Melbourne office 2-days per week.
The successful candidate must be a strong collaborator with cross-functional teams, be a natural leader with the ability to work autonomously and self-manage with ease and have exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders across all levels of the business.
WHAT YOU’D BE DOING IN THIS ROLE
Facilitate monthly S&OP cycle with cross-functional team consisting of Partnership, Finance and Marketing.
Quantify risks & opportunities by understanding POS trend, regional DC inventory level, customer constraints.
Understand and explain key drivers of the forecast change
Develop item-customer level or item-market level forecast using historical data, shipment patterns, and intelligence from Customer, Partnership, and Marketing
Use history cleansing & standard statistical modeling techniques to generate the baseline statistical forecast
Maintain a detailed knowledge of all components of the building block including: Baseline, Promotion uplifts, Sales & Marketing intelligence, New product introductions, Market trends, and Growth target
Establish planning sessions with customer SC teams, and provide customer-level insight to the broader team
Perform ongoing analysis and monitoring of customer pacing to forecast, identify significant variances using exception reports, and take corrective actions
Provide consistent forecast accuracy and customer service level to the Partnership teams
Manage the forecast bias, forecast variances and makes recommendations to partnership and marketing teams to execute the necessary adjustments
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED TO GET THE JOB DONE
Advanced math, analytical, and statistical skills
Experience with Forecast & Replenishment Applications and relevant education OR equivalent work experience with Forecasting, S&OP, and MRP is an asset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint)
High sense of urgency and ability to multitask and to adapt to quickly changing priorities
Proven track record of building strong relationships with cross-functional stakeholders to align on a common goal and very strong presentation skills; comfortable presenting to Senior Management
Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically, persistent attention to detail, and very comfortable with numbers with sound business acumen
WHAT YOU’LL BE GAINING BY JOINING OUR TEAM
There’s a lot of good stuff that comes along with being a DECIEM team member. Here are a few of our favourite perks and benefits, in no particular order…
Generous Annual Leave & Personal Days, plus additional time off for volunteering in your community, peaceful protesting, celebrating your birthday, and more.
6 months of paid time off for new parents (inclusive of all genders).
Work from anywhere 4 weeks per year.
A hybrid work model.
Summer Fridays - finish at 1pm all summer long!
A dog-friendly office (and lots of cute dogs to play with).
Unlimited access to our Employee Assistance Program that includes mental health care, mindfulness programs, and more.
Access to Development Grants & a LinkedIn Learning membership to help you keep growing and learning.
A generous discount on DECIEM products for you, your family, and your friends.
BUILDING GROWTH TO POWER GOOD
We are a People first company that lives by our core values to…
Do the right thing
Create impact
Respect small things
❤️ Care too much
Be the future
These values continue to guide us in all that we do. Along the way, we’ve been honoured to win some pretty incredible awards, including a CEW Achiever Award, Best Skincare Brand at Sunday Times Style Beauty Awards, and Most Popular Sustainable Brand by The Cosmetify Index Global. We’re still blushing!
SUSTAINABILITY AND SOCIAL IMPACT
DECIEM’s objective is to build growth and do good things while prioritizing people, animals, and the Earth.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst with State Government. The Senior Data Analyst role undertakes complex technical activities and projects related to data linkage and integration. This includes providing technical linkage services to develop and maintain the Victorian Linkage Map of 35 plus datasets and supporting the enduring data linkage program for the Department. The role also responds to linkage requests from government and researchers and provides technical support to national linked data projects
Accountabilities
Undertake multiple projects and requests for data linkage or integration, ensuring completion within timelines to a high standard.
Build and maintain effective working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, including policy and program areas, academic researchers and other government departments.
Provide expert input to projects to improve the quality and effectiveness of data linkage and integration processes, and access to and usability of the de-identified linked data resource.
Produce high quality documentation to communicate data linkage processes and the results of linked data analysis to a range of audiences
Establish and maintain effective working relationships across the department and work in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Provide expert advice on the quality, accuracy and relevance of data for data linkage purposes, to support research, policy development, program development, and evaluation.
Keep accurate and complete records of your work activities in accordance with legislative requirements and the department's records, information security and privacy policies and requirements.
Demonstrate how the actions and outcomes of this role and work unit impact clients and the department's ability to deliver, or facilitate the delivery of, effective support and services.
Key selection criteria
Technical expertise
Workplace experience and advanced skills in the management and analysis of large administrative and/or clinical datasets
Experience in in working with personally identifiable information (e.g., names, addresses, SLK) and applying deterministic and/or probabilistic data linkage methodologies
Advanced skills in Python, with experience using Pyspark functionality highly desired.
Exposure to the Microsoft Azure data science environment, particularly Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks, would be advantageous.

About Us

Who We Are

Murdoch Children’s is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity, equity and respect that celebrates and values the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our people. The Opportunity:

The position involves a range of duties to support the Senior Project Officer in running the project.

Assisting with developing applications and study protocols such as: submission of ethics approval, trial registration, and the regulatory documentation required by the Ethics, research governance, and trial registry groups.

Engaging in the campus culture including professional development activities and attending internal/external campus conferences and seminars

Strong interpersonal skills with experience communicating to a wide range of stakeholders

About ACER

The Australian Council for Educational Research (ACER) is one of the world’s leading educational research and development organisations. ACER has offices in Melbourne, Perth, Adelaide, Sydney and Brisbane and accepts applications for the positions described in any of these offices.

About The Position

The Education Policy and Practice Program is looking to employ two talented and motivated Researchers. The employment is based on a one-year contract with a possibility of switching to an ongoing contract.

The Education Policy and Practice Program undertakes commissioned work and provides consultancies for a range of agencies, including Australian Education Departments, national education departments in other countries, and NGOs and other international organisations. The program also provides advisory services and support for other programs within ACER. ACER emphasises the use of evidence to inform policy and practice and the focus of the Education Policy and Practice Program is to provide advice and capacity building support to clients on learning assessment theory, practice and policy.

The successful candidates will be engaged in project work that involves undertaking literature reviews, contributing to research reports, and project coordination, administration and management. Respective roles may require short periods of travel.

The successful candidates will, at a minimum, hold a graduate degree preferably in education, social sciences or policy-related disciplines.

A sound knowledge of social science research methods, including quantitative and/or qualitative skills, and data visualisation skills are required. Familiarity with survey methods, complex samples, mixed-effects modelling, item response modelling, and various quantitative analysis applications is preferrable.

Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential. The successful candidate will be able to write about technical topics in an engaging way and in plain English. Data visualisation skills are

Knowledge and experience in the areas of learning assessment, survey research and policy analysis are an advantage.

This position ideally suits someone who wants to learn about and contribute further to evidence-based policy making in education. The successful candidates will be working in an expert team environment and will have exposure to a diverse array of high-impact projects. ACER provides ongoing professional development to staff.

Salary is within the range of $89,690 – $99,132, plus 10.5 % ACER contribution to superannuation. This position is a full-time (1.0 FTE) 12-month opportunity and can be based at any of ACER’s offices located in Melbourne, Perth, Adelaide, Sydney and Brisbane.


Applications close 12 am (AEDT) Monday 19 December 2022.

For more information about ACER and to apply, go to https://www.acer.org/au/about-us/careers/current-opportunities.

Job Description
Location: Melbourne | Western Metropolitan
Job type: Full time / From 27/01/2023 - 20/12/2023
Organisation: Education and Training
Salary: Salary not specified
Occupation: Education and Training
Reference: 1323042
Selection Criteria
SC1 Demonstrated experience and skills in coordinating a specific education support function.
SC2 Demonstrated capacity to supervise the work of other support staff and to develop procedures and guidelines relating to the work area.
SC3 Demonstrated high level oral and written communication skills.
SC4 Possess the technical knowledge and expertise relevant to the position.
SC5 Demonstrated capacity to provide advice and support to management in respect to the work area.
SC6 Demonstrated commitment to professional learning and growth for both self and others.
Role
The Youth Worker in this position will provide and assist with the coordination of the school response to the wellbeing needs of students and their families with emphasis on strategies and approaches through consultation and direction from the Student Wellbeing Co-ordinator and Leadership Team.
Provides support to teachers and students. Within an educational program assist teachers with the coordination of the support function, such as organising the work of other support staff or providing a specialist support role.
Undertake medical intervention support tasks or other specialised student/teacher support roles that require specific training that must be updated from time to time. The role is for a specific purpose for which there will be direct accountability as opposed to support roles that are carried out by a range of staff performing routine tasks under direction.
Performs and/or supervises tasks that are carried out in accordance with guidelines, accepted practice and school policy. This may include the supervision and coordination of other education support class staff within the work area or educational program. Supervision and coordination would be limited to ensuring routine tasks are performed to required standards. Input into identifying training needs and development of education support class staff within the work area or educational program becomes an important feature at range 2.
Specialised support to achieve specific outcomes is a feature of range 2. Typically this will involve accountability for a single function, (e.g. ensuring data is properly maintained) or the operation of a work area (e.g. managing the day to day operation of a school office) under the direction of the principal or another senior manager.
Provides support to teachers and students that is beyond the routine support provided at education support class Level 1, range 1. Within an educational program assists teachers with the coordination of the support function, such as directing/organising the work of other support staff or providing a specialist support role.
Undertakes medical intervention support tasks or other specialised student/teacher support roles that require specific training that must be updated from time to time. The role is for a specific purpose for which there will be direct accountability as opposed to support roles that are carried out by a range of staff performing routine tasks under direction.
Performs technical tasks that require a sound knowledge of basic technical and/or scientific principles that are used to develop and adapt work methods and make judgements where there are clear guidelines and limited options. Routine technical support in libraries, science and information technology laboratories would be typical examples.
An education support class position supports the educational services being provided to students, but must not include duties of teaching as defined in clause 2.6.1 of the Education and Training Reform Act 2006 (Vic) or its successor. Supervision of students cannot be required except where it is an integral part of the employee's position or involves supervision of students individually or in small groups, in controlled circumstances, where the responsibility for students remains clearly with a teacher.
Responsibilities
Case management of at -risk students
Assist to develop and implement whole school preventative programs
Liaise with student Co-ordinator, staff, parents and students regarding at risk students
Have the capacity to form positive relationships with students
Work with the Wellbeing, Integration and School Leaders to develop and implement wellbeing based programs that support student learning.
Liaise with the Leadership team when necessary.
Have effective communication skills, enabling them to form positive relationships with community agencies, parents and members of the wider community.
Provide individualised support to students and their families where appropriate.

EEO AND OHS Commitment
The Department of Education and Training is committed to the principles of equal opportunity, and diversity and inclusion for all. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are strongly encouraged to apply for roles within the Department. Child Safe Standards
Victorian government schools are child safe environments. Our schools actively promote the safety and wellbeing of all students, and all school staff are committed to protecting students from abuse or harm in the school environment, in accordance with their legal obligations including child safe standards. All schools have a Child Safety Code of Conduct consistent with the Department’s exemplar available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/about/programs/health/protect/Pages/childsafestandards.aspx
DET Values
The Department’s employees commit to upholding DET’s Values: Responsiveness, Integrity, Impartiality, Accountability, Respect, Leadership and Human Rights. Location Profile
Victoria University Secondary College is a multi-campus school comprising a Junior Campus, Senior Campus with a Trade Training Centre. The college has approximately 1010 students from years 7 to 12 and services the residential area of Cairnlea, Deer Park, and environs in the western suburbs of Melbourne. The college caters for students from diverse cultural and social backgrounds and provides a broad range of personal, academic and practical experiences for students. The college values each student and successfully provides curriculum and other services to meet student needs. Victoria University Secondary College challenges students to create the future by aspiring to achieve, strengthening the community and respecting themselves and others. There is a strong expectation that students take themselves seriously and work hard to build on the firm foundation provided by the College.
The organization of the College is based on the concept of Professional Learning Communities an approach to school improvement where groups of teachers work collaboratively at the school level to improve student outcomes. At VUSC we strive to enhance our teaching practices by sharing resources and analysing student data. Our staff also support other schools to implement effective PLC practices, as we are a PLC Link school.
The College empowers members of our learning community to develop control over their own thinking and actions, develop the self-belief and confidence to persevere with learning challenges and tasks and to take initiative and act. Our focus on reflective thinking develops independent learners. Our focus on collaboration develops students who can work co-operatively towards a common goal; to share ideas and resources while respecting and recognising individual contributions. Students develop the skills to create respectful learning relationships within the school and the wider community.
Victoria University Secondary College is a supportive teaching and learning environment where student needs and backgrounds are reflected in the learning and design of the school. The clear strategic intention is to maximize opportunities for all students by developing their talents and challenging them to have high aspirations, so they achieve their potential and become logical, self-aware, collaborative and inquisitive. Importantly, Victoria University Secondary College seeks to develop skills and competencies, so students are well prepared for future study and work when they finish their education.

About the role

12 Month Fixed Term Opportunity

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving our customers’ financial wellbeing so they can achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

We are is search for a Release Lead, who will be apart of Enterprise Analytics & Applied AI (EAI) Tribe within the Enterprise Data & Intelligent Automation (EDIA) Domain, Who will be responsible for driving business outcomes and coordinating across multiple platforms and cross-functional teams to deliver data requirements for the business. You will need recent hands on knowledge and be very comfortable with leading, planning, and executing complex in-squad and cross-tribe initiatives in an agile environment. You need to be people focused and build and maintain relationships, deal with pressure and negotiate with ease with business stakeholders.

What will your day look like

We are is search for a Release Lead, who will be apart of Enterprise Analytics & Applied AI (EAI) Tribe within the Enterprise Data & Intelligent Automation (EDIA) Domain, Who will be responsible for driving business outcomes and coordinating across multiple platforms and cross-functional teams to deliver data requirements for the business. You will need recent hands on knowledge and be very comfortable with leading, planning, and executing complex in-squad and cross-tribe initiatives in an agile environment. You need to be people focused and build and maintain relationships, deal with pressure and negotiate with ease with business stakeholders.

The primary focus of the Enterprise Analytics & Applied AI Tech Area is to create a system of people, process and technology (on premise and cloud), built for agility, to provide the data and capabilities for our customer facing business areas (including Australia and Institutional divisions) to create business and customer value by being in the moment with our customers.

Building the ANZ Data grid and solutions including sourcing, integration, processing and making data available for use, on premise & on-cloud.
Deliver innovative data solutions and insights in partnership with the business, tooling and advanced data science techniques (machine learning, deep learning) to create business value
Build and maintain the frameworks (real-time and batch) to populate and keep current a Big Data Lake - as the one-stop place for ANZ’s data needs
Accelerate data driven customer solutions.
What will you bring?

To be successful in this role, you’ll ideally bring the following:

Leverage business acumen and technical knowledge to influence outcomes and deliver value for a release
Experience driving release planning and implementation whilst establishing, and communicating, the release plan to stakeholders
Assist business with complex risk profiling – identify and assess risks and controls
Ensure Technology Areas have the right tooling and schedule release model in place to ensure outcomes are delivered on time
Able to introduce and efficiently use tools to manage and monitor project spend against budgets and other framework delivery tools
Successfully plan and managed work through a delivery lifecycle to realise strategic objectives and customer outcomes
Successfully coordinate and / or execute technical deployment activities to deliver customer outcomes
Experience working with Agile delivery at appropriate scale
Experience on continuous improvement in the change delivery cycle
Manage interdependencies across multiple streams of work
Manage and mitigate delivery risk
Successfully build a network of strong relationships and influence key stakeholders
Experience / Certification in PM frameworks
Experience / Certification with Agile and sound knowledge of Scrum and iterative release delivery
We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.

So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter.

We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being a Release Lead at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off
Great discounts on our financial products, and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap
Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads, with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us?

Click Apply Now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role.

We are seeking a Software Engineer for a contract until 30/6/2023. The Data Engineer role is responsible for managing and optimising the data pipeline to support quality data outcomes. The focus of this role will be to support delivery of digital planning reform initiatives.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities for this engagement are primarily:
Build resilient, secure high-performance infrastructure required for optimal ETL/ELT processes from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, Azure and AWS 'data lake' technologies.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.
Contribute to building analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into the planning system performance.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product and Data teams to resolve data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Collaborate with data and analytics experts to deliver greater functionality in our data systems.
Work flexibly and collaboratively across the business to deliver business unit, group and DELWP priorities and initiatives as required.
Practice cultural safety by creating environments, relationships, and systems free from racism and discrimination so that people can feel safe, valued and able to participate.
Key Selection Criteria
Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications:
A tertiary degree in a relevant discipline such as IT, Computer Science or relevant experience.
Strong experience building data applications and managing data pipelines on AWS or Azure, with a preference for AWS
Extensive background in cleansing, combining, and processing data and strong knowledge of BI tools
Experience working in a mix of cloud, legacy, and modern architecture services
Experience with data warehouses, data lakes and ETL/ELT tool chains
Capabilities
Stakeholder Management
Identifies and manages a range of complex and often competing needs. Identifies issues in common for one or more stakeholders and uses them to build mutually beneficial partnerships.
Finds innovative solutions to resolve stakeholder issues.
Systems Thinking
Formulates potential courses of action to achieve objectives based on an in-depth understanding of the business environment and its systems.
Establishes an integrated perspective of their organisation's services and identifies the leverage points where intervention will add value.
Problem Solving:
Anticipates potential problems and pre-empts required actions.
Continually liaises with key stakeholders to ensure full understanding of the issues.
Evaluates implemented courses of action and makes adjustments as required.
Planning and Organising:
Sets time aside to think.
Sets clearly defined objectives and priorities.
Delegates responsibilities to ensure goals are met.
Liaises with others when organising work.
Anticipates barriers and finds effective ways to deal with them.

Work with agriculture and science team in Victoria for a state government department.
Your new company
A key stakeholder who works with industry and community stakeholders to support the agriculture, food, and fibre sector to become more globally competitive, innovative, and resilient.

Your new role
Work in Invertebrate and Weed Sciences group, which delivers research in integrated pest management, invertebrate diagnostics, and surveillance, weed management and biological control of invertebrate pests and weeds. You’ll:
Provide and coordinate technical support for laboratory and field work associated with the conservation biological control projects at the AgriBio Centre
Specific tasks include sampling invertebrate populations, processing and identifying samples, and transcribing data
Assist with other projects within the Invertebrate and Weed Sciences group

What you'll need to succeed
You’ll have:
Degree in biology, chemistry, entomology, ecology, botany, agricultural science, or related discipline
Experience in one or more of the following areas: biosecurity research or operations, entomology, botany, undertaking biossays, maintaining insect cultures, biological control, insect diagnostics, IPM in orchards, weed management, field experiments, sorting and counting insects

About the role

Protect our Customers, Communities and ANZ against financial crime threats
Utilise customer data and intelligence to detect, investigate, and escalate potentially suspicious activity
Work within the Financial Crime Portfolio to support businesses across the Group in complying with financial crime regulatory obligations
Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008
Role Type: Permanent – Full Time

Note: 2 available opportunities

In this role you will be joining the Financial Crime Threat Management Team as Customer Monitoring and Detection Senior Analyst. You will assume responsibility for assessing and coordinating improvements to financial crime filtering solutions, to improve detection capabilities and the quality of alerts generated. You will work closely with other teams in Financial Crime to identify changes needed to improve detection coverage and design solutions to achieve these improvements based on typology reports, intelligence findings and risk assessments.

What will your day look like

As a Financial Crime Analytics Senior Analyst, Customer Monitoring and Detection, you will:

Review inputs to identify and prioritise improvements to financial crime detection systems with specific focus on AML Transaction Monitoring and Customer Risk scoring / monitoring solutions.
Design, develop and implement solutions to improve the efficacy of AML detection and customer risk rating solutions
Maintaining and building relationships within the Financial Crime Portfolio and platform delivery squads for AML & Sanctions platforms
Provide SME support to the Customer and Monitoring Detection Manager with regard to technology and filtering requirements and solutions
Enhance reporting and insights of the Financial Crime detection solutions
Develop and maintain documentation to demonstrate linkage between Financial Crime risks, coverage requirements and detection solutions in accordance with defined processes and Model Validation requirements.
Support the effective management of compliance and operational risk with a simplification and efficiency lens that drives adherence to legal, compliance, regulatory standards and internal policies and procedures
What will you bring?

To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Relevant experience in Financial Crime/ Regulatory / Compliance and or financial systems.
Commitment to quality and alignment of standards; ability to engage with others to gain buy-in and act as an advocate for continuous improvement. Proactively identifies, support and drive opportunities to manage financial crime risks.
A deep understanding and awareness of statistical and data concepts, with experience in application of these concepts (within a financial crime context)
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex issues in a clear and succinct manner that is understandable by all
Ability to manage priorities and conflicting issues in a professional manner, including strong influencing skills
Advanced data management & manipulation skills – Excel, SQL, SAS, Python, Machine Learning
Experience in technology and process governance requirements when deploying technology solutions
University degree in Quantitative discipline supported by practical application of knowledge in industry (Computer Science / Mathematics / Information Technology) is highly regarded
So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter.

We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off
Great discounts on our financial products, and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap
Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads, with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us?

Click Apply Now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

Working within a data team of 12 analyst/programmers who manage the support and delivery of an R based platform, the Data Analyst will be responsible for reviewing data and creating new analytical programs for the verification of fine data.

Optional flu shots, paid for by us!
Direct and transparent access to our Managing Director and Leadership team. No hierarchical red tape here!
Wednesday cheese platters!
Individual Learning & Development budget for upskilling and keeping up with Industry trends!
Personalised training & development programs (We have had team members get new certifications, do toast masters and so much more) and discounts on Udemy Courses!
Regular back to base days for all our offsite and remote team members
Appscore has a hybrid working environment. We are flexible with working from home/our office. We have regular team lunches, puppy cuddles from our office dog Missy, table tennis and an office bar available to all staff.

The position of Scientist, Riparian and Wetland Ecology will have a focus on wetland, floodplain and river ecology and conservation, and will contribute to the delivery of quality research undertaken at the Arthur Rylah Institute for Environmental Research (ARI).
Are you passionate about understanding and protecting Victoria's aquatic ecosystems and being outdoors? Are you interested in working with enthusiastic and experienced scientists in this field and collaborating with natural resource managers? Have you got experience in undertaking field surveys and identifying plants and/or birds?
If yes, then this science role at the Arthur Rylah Institute may be for you.
The Scientist, Riparian and Wetland Ecology role requires experience in contributing to vegetation- and/or bird-focused ecological monitoring, evaluation and reporting. The role requires field work, four-wheel driving, hiking, conducting plant and bird surveys, data management and report writing.
If this sounds like you then we offer:
A link to nature
A competitive salary
A positive team working environment
Full-time or part-time working arrangements, and the ability to undertake some work from home as part of our flexible working environment.
Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications
A science degree and work experience with a focus on plant and/or bird ecology.
A high level of competency in plant and bird identification and survey techniques.
Ability to participate in, support and, under supervision, plan and manage conservation and ecology surveys and projects in the field and office, and to contribute to multi-disciplinary research teams.
Ability to contribute to advice, reports, scientific articles, conference presentations, and other communication outputs.
This is a fixed term position available for a period of 2 years. The work location for this position is Heidelberg.
To be considered for this position, applicants are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter (no longer than 2 pages) summarising their skills and relevant experience.
For further information please refer to the attached position description.
Applications close at midnight on Monday, 16 January 2023.

DELWP is seeking to establish a new dedicated in-house energy market modelling unit housed within the Energy Group. This is a fantastic opportunity to help embed a data and modelling-driven approach across the Victorian Government's efforts to guide the energy transition and meet the state's long-term net zero greenhouse gas emissions target.
You will be part of a new dedicated in-house energy market intelligence unit housed within DELWP's Energy Group and help shape the team from the ground up. This role includes access to flexible and hybrid working arrangements.

The Scientist, Riparian and Wetland Ecology role requires experience in contributing to vegetation- and/or bird-focused ecological monitoring, evaluation and reporting. The role requires field work, four-wheel driving, hiking, conducting plant and bird surveys, data management and report writing.
If this sounds like you then we offer:
A link to nature
A competitive salary
A positive team working environment
Full-time or part-time working arrangements, and the ability to undertake some work from home as part of our flexible working environment.
Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications
A science degree and work experience with a focus on plant and/or bird ecology.
A high level of competency in plant and bird identification and survey techniques.
Ability to participate in, support and, under supervision, plan and manage conservation and ecology surveys and projects in the field and office, and to contribute to multi-disciplinary research teams.
Ability to contribute to advice, reports, scientific articles, conference presentations, and other communication outputs.
This is a fixed term position available for a period of 2 years. The work location for this position is Heidelberg.
To be considered for this position, applicants are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter (no longer than 2 pages) summarising their skills and relevant experience.

We also understand that a balanced life is important to our employees. The Opportunity
We have a 12-month fixed-term opportunity available for a Scientist to join our Research team, based at Bio-21 Institute. As a qualified scientist you will join a high-profile research focussed, laboratory-based team that works at the interface between research and clinical development. You will support the R&D of therapeutic proteins by developing and implementing high-quality bioassay and biomarkers. You will provide important information to allow for scientifically based decisions in research, toxicology and early clinical development studies.
You will lead the scientific research from the bench, with the development of relevant new assays and assess the feasibility of biomarkers and bioassays for inclusion in research, GLP toxicology and clinical studies.
You may partner with our research colleagues from across the global research sites including Marburg in Germany and Bern in Switzerland.
Main responsibilities include:
Provide and apply well-developed scientific and technical capability in respect of bioassay and biomarker development to support research and development of novel protein based/biologic therapies
Maintain awareness of new scientific/technical strategies in the area of bioassay and biomarker development
Assess novel target specific bioassays via literature reviews and experimental screening to determine relevance and suitability to address program goals.
Attend, participate and present at research group meetings/reviews
Ensure documentation and recording of all laboratory notes and research on projects is up-to-date, secure and accessible in accordance to Laboratory Notebook guidelines
Prepare clear standard operating procedures, validation protocols and scientific reports.
Collaborate with the supervising Senior and Research Scientists in planning and carrying out experimental work relevant to project specific goals
To be successful:
You will have tertiary qualifications in Science along with laboratory experience, with at least 3 years experience in pre-clinical and clinical development of biopharmaceuticals or equivalent related experience in industry or academic environments.
You can undertake novel approaches to basic scientific questions independently and part of a team
You have hands-on assay development experience of novel and bespoke biomarkers using analytical techniques such as ligand-binding assays (ELISA, MSD, bead arrays, multiplex), enzymatic assays and cell-based assays.
You will have excellent communication skills and be able to grasp complex problems, identify solutions and make data-driven recommendations to support programs.
Experience working with scientific graphics programmes.

Job Title
Senior Developer
Job Summary
The Network Engineering-Senior Engineer is a critical contributor in ensuring that the Telstra network delivers a superior network experience for our consumer and business customers. You do this by drawing on your deep levels of telecommunications network expertise and experience to provide specialist analysis, design, development and deployment in network specific technology domains, including developing platform specific technology roadmaps and making technology investment recommendations.
Job Description
At Telstra, our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. It's a future that won't happen on its own, it has to be delivered — and only Telstra can bring together all the parts to create it. And, this is where YOU come in, by playing your part in help our customers connect: faster, better and smarter.
The role with us
The Senior Developer role will be develop business logic, data management and systems integration services to enable customer end users to manage their network product planning, configuration, deployment and operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, build, install, integrate and maintain software and integrations which implement product logic and processes to support customer, partner and Telstra employee control of complex network technologies and platforms for fixed network provisioning and operations
Translate customer (internal, external or regulatory) needs and requirements, using technical principles into reusable API based micro-services, data models, workflows, and integrations
Negotiate and agree on frontend and peer system integration API specifications to implement required user experience and end-to-end processes
Work with Product Owners and Technical Product Owners to develop business and technology roadmaps
Utilise on-premises and cloud technologies to deploy and host applications
Accountable for Backend Micro-Services, using Java
Use existing code repositories and CICD pipelines to deploy into development and production environments
Utilising Agile ceremonies and practices, lead planning, design and estimation sessions.
Integrate solutions by executing on security and operational requirements
Assess capability of third party and open source libraries and tools to meet business requirements and manage software supply chain delivery
Assess capability of internal libraries, tools, APIs and systems and offerings to meet business requirements
Develop platform-specific technology functionality for business requirements that leverage opportunities from evolving and future technologies
Participate in a DevOps and DevSecOps environment and team.
About you
To be successful in the role, you need to have:
Essential
A Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or similar discipline.
Typically, a minimum of 5-10 years’ experience working in an Operational and/or Software Engineering role and have expertise with a variety of deployment, automation, configuration management and optimisation tools.
Strong experience in one (or more) of the following technologies:
Java
JavaScript
Java Springboot
NodeJS
Python
Exposure to network automation, Software Defined Networking and NFVi concepts and technology
Proven programming experience that conforms to good software engineering design principles and practices (including version management). This includes experience with API integration.
Practical experience with Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines. Enhancing and improving CI/CD capabilities to reduce cycle time while retaining quality
Experience designing and implementing Infrastructure-as-Code, such as Terraform
Experience in delivering projects as part of an agile team and exposure to DevOps teams, practices and tools
Willingness to learn new technologies and keen to drive innovation
Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving and time management skills
Strong interpersonal and consultative skills
Strong desire to learn and drive skills to expert level in the domain
Proactive and self-motivated

QinetiQ employs more than 6000 people in 51 locations around the world, offering our customers premier expertise in advice, services and creative technology-based products.

QinetiQ Australia, part of the global QinetiQ group, provides technological and scientific expertise to help customers protect and advance their vital interests. As an innovative science and technology company, we help solve some of our customers' most challenging problems. Our determination to deliver and improve today and anticipate and shape tomorrow, makes QinetiQ a very exciting, rewarding and respected place to work and learn.

Join the Telstra Creator Space team and work with University of Melbourne’s future innovators in Melbourne Connect

Help shape and contribute to the student engagement and experience in the Telstra Creator Space
Start your career with an endorsed Employer of Choice

Do you have a passion for one or more of the following fields? Electronics, 3D Printing, Woodwork, Motion Capture, Making and Design.

Do you love to work with people, prototype, tinker and innovate?

This is the role for you!

We are currently looking for multiple Student Guides to join our Engineering Services business, based in Melbourne on a casual basis.

Working with Australia’s top ranked University (University of Melbourne), our Engineering Services division offers multi-disciplinary professional engineering and technical services to academia and their students. As the engineering and technical service provider for Melbourne School of Engineering’s Telstra Creator Space, QinetiQ has a key role in developing the next generation of Scientists, Technologists, Engineers and Mathematicians. The Telstra Creator Space is part of Australia’s newest innovation hub at Melbourne Connect in Parkville and will be a focal point for engineering and IT students of all disciplines.

As Student Guide your responsibilities will include:
Provide support to, and supervise safe operations by, Telstra Creator Space users
Ensure a user-centred, safe and efficient Telstra Creator Space experience for all users
Welcome and direct users to relevant work areas of the Telstra Creator Space
Liaise with Science Gallery Melbourne on use of the Telstra Creator Space
Contribute to Telstra Creator Space events & projects that improve student engagement and experience
Administer training and quality management records and notifications
Assist with the scheduling and operations of the Telstra Creator Space
Collate service performance data from a variety of sources

To be successful in the role of Student Guide you will need to bring with you:

Strong desire to mentor students and makers in a prototyping environment
Be undergoing relevant tertiary education at UoM – (Bachelor of Science or Design, Masters of Engineering or IT) with majors in either, mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, software engineering, computing sciences or visual arts
Strong organisational skills and a structured approach to work
Curiosity in engineering and technical skills
In line with the spirit of making, we would love see a project that you have built (or designed) included in your CV. Please keep this section to half a single page

To align with the opening hours of Telstra Creator Space, shifts will be rostered between 10am – 7pm Monday to Friday

Applicants MUST be eligible to obtain an Australian Government security clearance. QinetiQ conducts pre-employment screening, including but not limited to identity verification and police checks, for all preferred candidates

About Amber
Amber is a new way to buy power, designed for a world powered by renewable energy. We give customers direct access to the real-time wholesale electricity price as it varies every 30 mins and the technology to shift more of their energy usage to the times when cheaper renewables are available in the grid. It’s a cheaper way to buy power and the fastest way for Australia to reach 100% renewable energy.
We are growing rapidly and have thousands of customers who love what we are doing with a great product that will play a significant role in driving Australia towards a renewable future. We are backed by Australia’s leading VCs including Square Peg Capital, Giant Leap (Impact Investment Group) and Black Sheep Capital. We’re now at a critical moment in taking the business to a real scale as we disrupt a huge market for the better.
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world. You’d be a part of a rapidly growing team of 70 with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations.
About the role
Want to help improve the environment by shifting Australia’s energy usage towards renewables?
Data is critical to Amber's long-term success. You will join a team defining the data vision for the whole company and coordinate with others using the platform to make data ingestion & consumption easier for all.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer who is excited about applying their analytical and engineering skills to define, measure and ultimately democratise data, metrics and insights that drive decision-making here at Amber.
We'll use the insights that you and the team gather to understand and align Amber's long-term strategy. You'll be working with a community of experts who have deep expertise across Financial and Energy analytics that will utilise this intelligence to accelerate our mission of switching Australia's energy usage.
Though this role is primarily Data Engineering (80%) it will also involve some Data Analyst responsibilities (20%).
You will be in a team with core responsibility for building out our data infrastructure, pipelines and supporting many arms of the business with data collection, data refinement and data extraction. This is where your data analyst expertise will be required.
Key Responsibilities
- Work closely with the management team to identify important questions , sources of truth and answer them with data.
- Define data dictionaries for key metrics across the business and define datamarts for broad consumption.
- Improve automation, reporting and visualization of metrics in modern BI tools including Tableau, PowerBI, Fivetran etc.
- Partner with the engineering team to select the tools and build the pipelines and processes behind our analytics infrastructure
- Apply models on large datasets to measure results and outcomes.
- Improve overall quality, testing procedures and accessibility of our data.
About You
- 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Science, or Data Engineer.
- Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering).
- Very strong knowledge of SQL to query databases and data sources.
- Knowledge of DBT.
- Experience with AWS, ETL and data lakes.
- You'll get to work on a modern data stack within AWS, utilising a combination of tools such as Snowflake, dbt, Hevo, Tableau, PowerBI, Sigma, Github.
- Happy/comfortable/willing to work in a start-up or fast-paced environments
Benefits
- We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world.
- You’d be a part of a rapidly growing team of over 50 with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations.
- Be part of a growing technology start-up that will shape the future of renewable energy in Australia.
- Exciting new office location in the CBD.
- Flexible working hours (Hybrid) with provision for regular work-from-home arrangements (1-day from office and rest is work from home)
- We offset 100% of your carbon footprint for as long as you work with us (via Nul).
- Equitable gender-neutral parental leave policies,
- An external Employee Assistance Plan for mental health support.
- Competitive salary and shares in Amber.
- Annual Learning & Development budget to support your personal growth.
This is a full-time role to be based ideally from Melbourne, but we are also open to considering the right candidate anywhere within Australia.
We are also open to working 4 days a week if that's what you are looking for. Due to COVID, we mostly work from home, catching up in our CBD-based office every now and then. We expect to remain Melbourne based but maintain flexibility between the office and WFH.
If this kind of work gets you excited, we'd love to hear from you!
Even if you don’t meet 100% of the requirements listed above, we still encourage you to apply. We're open to all backgrounds and encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
How to Apply
To apply please submit your resume and a cover letter. In your cover letter, please answer the following questions:
- What’s the mathematical relationship between the wholesale price published on AEMO (https://www.aemo.com.au/) and the price Amber customers pay?
- What’s your current favourite analytics tool that you’re using at the moment and why?
Our process will generally be as follows:
- A screening interview with our talent team
- A follow up interview with our co-CEO (Chris Thompson) and CTO (John Barton)
- A take home case study for pre-read/preparation ahead of a discussion with our Engineering Manager (Mat Brennan) and Senior Data Analyst (Owen O'doherty)
- A final chat with our CTO (John Barton)
We promise to be respectful of your time as an applicant while trying to be as thorough as possible in finding the right fit for our team.
Applications only from candidates already based in Australia please. No recruitment firms.
“We are Common” by Common Code are assisting Amber with building their team. Any CVs will be forwarded to the "We Are Common" team.
