Date: 08-Dec-2022

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU

Department: Enabling Areas

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 28621

Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best
Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career
Training on and access to leading data science and machine learning platform

What will your typical day look like?

As a key member of this internal facing team, you will provide data engineering, analysis, and reporting/visualisation support for a wide range of high impact and visible projects. You will engage with stakeholders at all levels to understand and execute business improvement/streamlining opportunities leveraging data and analytics.

Role Responsibilities

Involved in the full data and analytics value chain including Business Analysis, Problem Definition, and Project Scoping – you will understand, document and track business needs and requirements throughout the project life cycle, analyse requirements, create functional specifications, use-cases, and develop both business and technical process flow diagrams. You will engage decision modelling, business process mapping, and business rules management and work closely with architects and developers to understand solution options, feasibility, effort, and technical constraints.

Data Engineering and Analysis activities will involve data structure/database design, data wrangling, cleaning, and data pipeline development, ELT including automation of this function and leveraging APIs. Analysis outputs will typically involve descriptive, reporting, and visualisation with increasing exposure to applied predictive learning. Your core foundational skills in SQL Server database querying and database management incl use of SQL Server Agent will be leveraged heavily as well as tools such as Tableau and PowerBI for reporting/visualisation with DevOps/DataOps- source code management via GIT. You will also be amongst the first cohort to be trained in and use a leading data science and machine learning platform.

About the team

The Tech Enablement is a small team within Deloitte’s Strategy and Innovation Office provides internal operational stakeholders with Technology, Data, and Analytics subject matter expertise, advice, and strategy, while championing consistency in execution across the firm. This team is charged with driving the firm’s strategy forward by leveraging fit-for-purpose data, reporting/visualisation, and analytics via appropriate technologies.

Differentiating with, and embedding data/analytics, design, and digital is core to our strategy of exceeding client expectations, adding value to our employee experience, and delivering operational excellence.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:
You are a passionate data engineer with complementary experience of delivering targeted analysis and reporting/visualisation to inform defined business objectives/outcomes.
You know that data is valuable but for that value to be unlocked via descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics and then operationalised, it must first be underpinned by solid data engineering.
You’re at home ‘getting your hands dirty’ with the data and very particular about driving data engineering and analysis efficiencies through automation with robust documentation, but equally comfortable interacting with business stakeholders, understanding and interpreting their requirements.
Predictive analytics/machine learning/AI is an area you’ve being trained in, had some exposure to, and/or delivered in the past, and you can demonstrate an interest in further development within this domain.

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

QinetiQ employs more than 6000 people in 51 locations around the world, offering our customers premier expertise in advice, services and creative technology-based products.

QinetiQ Australia, part of the global QinetiQ group, provides technological and scientific expertise to help customers protect and advance their vital interests. As an innovative science and technology company, we help solve some of our customers' most challenging problems. Our determination to deliver and improve today and anticipate and shape tomorrow, makes QinetiQ a very exciting, rewarding and respected place to work and learn.

Join the Telstra Creator Space team and work with University of Melbourne’s future innovators in Melbourne Connect

Help shape and contribute to the student engagement and experience in the Telstra Creator Space
Start your career with an endorsed Employer of Choice

Do you have a passion for one or more of the following fields? Electronics, 3D Printing, Woodwork, Motion Capture, Making and Design.

Do you love to work with people, prototype, tinker and innovate?

This is the role for you!

We are currently looking for multiple Student Guides to join our Engineering Services business, based in Melbourne on a casual basis.

Working with Australia’s top ranked University (University of Melbourne), our Engineering Services division offers multi-disciplinary professional engineering and technical services to academia and their students. As the engineering and technical service provider for Melbourne School of Engineering’s Telstra Creator Space, QinetiQ has a key role in developing the next generation of Scientists, Technologists, Engineers and Mathematicians. The Telstra Creator Space is part of Australia’s newest innovation hub at Melbourne Connect in Parkville and will be a focal point for engineering and IT students of all disciplines.

As Student Guide your responsibilities will include:
Provide support to, and supervise safe operations by, Telstra Creator Space users
Ensure a user-centred, safe and efficient Telstra Creator Space experience for all users
Welcome and direct users to relevant work areas of the Telstra Creator Space
Liaise with Science Gallery Melbourne on use of the Telstra Creator Space
Contribute to Telstra Creator Space events & projects that improve student engagement and experience
Administer training and quality management records and notifications
Assist with the scheduling and operations of the Telstra Creator Space
Collate service performance data from a variety of sources

To be successful in the role of Student Guide you will need to bring with you:

Strong desire to mentor students and makers in a prototyping environment
Be undergoing relevant tertiary education at UoM – (Bachelor of Science or Design, Masters of Engineering or IT) with majors in either, mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, software engineering, computing sciences or visual arts
Strong organisational skills and a structured approach to work
Curiosity in engineering and technical skills
In line with the spirit of making, we would love see a project that you have built (or designed) included in your CV. Please keep this section to half a single page

To align with the opening hours of Telstra Creator Space, shifts will be rostered between 10am – 7pm Monday to Friday

Applicants MUST be eligible to obtain an Australian Government security clearance. QinetiQ conducts pre-employment screening, including but not limited to identity verification and police checks, for all preferred candidates

Life at QinetiQ

Our people and our culture make QinetiQ a great place to work, we value integrity, collaboration and performance.

QinetiQ is a Workplace Gender Equality Agency Employer of Choice and past winner of the Defence Teaming Centre Employer of Choice Awards.

We look after our people are committed to attracting and retaining the best talent in the market. We celebrate our differences and incorporate diversity and inclusion into everything we do.

Please note that the QinetiQ team will be taking a break over the festive season. We appreciate your interest and patience in advance*

At ISPT, we might be in the business of property, but it’s our commitment to growth for people, places and communities that really drives us.

We generate returns for our Investors, some of Australia’s largest industry superannuation funds, and ultimately the 50%+ of working Australians who have their retirement savings invested in property through us.

Our team and our culture are some of our greatest strengths and we have an exciting new opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our team in Melbourne.

About the opportunity

This role will be responsible for contributing to data analytics which supports ISPT's bespoke Market Intelligence Data & Analytics System (MIDAS). MIDAS is built and maintained by Strategic Research and is the team's platform for delivering economic and market insights to support data-driven investment decisions. The Data Analyst will learn foundational skills in data analytics, including data principles, core tools (Excel, SQL, Python), and data visualisation (Tableau), and over time will work towards proficiency in cloud data engineering in Microsoft Azure. As such, this is a great opportunity to build the skills and experience needed to become a data engineer, working closely with and being coached by our Manager, Investment Analytics and Data Engineer!

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Updating and continuously improving the MIDAS data dictionaries which drive our analytics automation

Exploring relationships between datasets and variables through empirical analysis

Ingesting, cleaning and transforming data sources (mainly from subscriptions) through Azure to land in SQL, and mapping new data sources to data dictionaries

Building and/or validating insightful Tableau dashboards and assisting interpretation for insights and business recommendations.

Assisting in maintaining existing data sources, reviewing new sources, and contributing to proofs-of-concept (e.g. econometric and data science models exploring relationships between variables).

About you

Ideally you will be tertiary qualified in data engineering, data analytics, data science or a related discipline. You are passionate about working and solving problems with data, and applying good practices to ensure the robustness, reliability and efficiency of data analytics. You are looking for a supportive environment to learn, while showcasing your skills and developing the technical proficiency and experience you need to develop into a cloud data engineer.

You bring energy, passion for insights & data, and a positive attitude towards learning and developing your skills. Experience working with data and databases, performing exploratory analysis (including statistical analysis), and programming is essential. Skills with Excel, SQL, Python and cloud environments is an advantage.

We offer

We understand work is only a part of your life and we have generous benefits to enable you to focus on what is important to you

A flexible/ hybrid work environment

12DO – an additional day off every month!

Parental leave provisions for all employees (up to 16 weeks of full pay)

12% Superannuation

Salary continuance insurance

Generous short term incentive program

At ISPT we have an inclusive culture that welcomes and values diverse voices. It is important to us that every team member feels valued and respected for who they are, so if you require any adjustments to the recruitment process to equitably participate, please contact us on acooper@ispt.net.au or 0418 926 575.

About Amber
Amber is a new way to buy power, designed for a world powered by renewable energy. We give customers direct access to the real-time wholesale electricity price as it varies every 30 mins and the technology to shift more of their energy usage to the times when cheaper renewables are available in the grid. It’s a cheaper way to buy power and the fastest way for Australia to reach 100% renewable energy.
We are growing rapidly and have thousands of customers who love what we are doing with a great product that will play a significant role in driving Australia towards a renewable future. We are backed by Australia’s leading VCs including Square Peg Capital, Giant Leap (Impact Investment Group) and Black Sheep Capital. We’re now at a critical moment in taking the business to a real scale as we disrupt a huge market for the better.
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world. You’d be a part of a rapidly growing team of 70 with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations.
About the role
Want to help improve the environment by shifting Australia’s energy usage towards renewables?
Data is critical to Amber's long-term success. You will join a team defining the data vision for the whole company and coordinate with others using the platform to make data ingestion & consumption easier for all.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer who is excited about applying their analytical and engineering skills to define, measure and ultimately democratise data, metrics and insights that drive decision-making here at Amber.
We'll use the insights that you and the team gather to understand and align Amber's long-term strategy. You'll be working with a community of experts who have deep expertise across Financial and Energy analytics that will utilise this intelligence to accelerate our mission of switching Australia's energy usage.
Though this role is primarily Data Engineering (80%) it will also involve some Data Analyst responsibilities (20%).
You will be in a team with core responsibility for building out our data infrastructure, pipelines and supporting many arms of the business with data collection, data refinement and data extraction. This is where your data analyst expertise will be required.
Key Responsibilities
- Work closely with the management team to identify important questions , sources of truth and answer them with data.
- Define data dictionaries for key metrics across the business and define datamarts for broad consumption.
- Improve automation, reporting and visualization of metrics in modern BI tools including Tableau, PowerBI, Fivetran etc.
- Partner with the engineering team to select the tools and build the pipelines and processes behind our analytics infrastructure
- Apply models on large datasets to measure results and outcomes.
- Improve overall quality, testing procedures and accessibility of our data.
About You
- 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Science, or Data Engineer.
- Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering).
- Very strong knowledge of SQL to query databases and data sources.
- Knowledge of DBT.
- Experience with AWS, ETL and data lakes.
- You'll get to work on a modern data stack within AWS, utilising a combination of tools such as Snowflake, dbt, Hevo, Tableau, PowerBI, Sigma, Github.
- Happy/comfortable/willing to work in a start-up or fast-paced environments
Benefits
- We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world.
- You’d be a part of a rapidly growing team of over 50 with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations.
- Be part of a growing technology start-up that will shape the future of renewable energy in Australia.
- Exciting new office location in the CBD.
- Flexible working hours (Hybrid) with provision for regular work-from-home arrangements (1-day from office and rest is work from home)
- We offset 100% of your carbon footprint for as long as you work with us (via Nul).
- Equitable gender-neutral parental leave policies,
- An external Employee Assistance Plan for mental health support.
- Competitive salary and shares in Amber.
- Annual Learning & Development budget to support your personal growth.
This is a full-time role to be based ideally from Melbourne, but we are also open to considering the right candidate anywhere within Australia.
We are also open to working 4 days a week if that's what you are looking for. Due to COVID, we mostly work from home, catching up in our CBD-based office every now and then. We expect to remain Melbourne based but maintain flexibility between the office and WFH.
If this kind of work gets you excited, we'd love to hear from you!
Even if you don’t meet 100% of the requirements listed above, we still encourage you to apply. We're open to all backgrounds and encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
How to Apply
To apply please submit your resume and a cover letter. In your cover letter, please answer the following questions:
- What’s the mathematical relationship between the wholesale price published on AEMO (https://www.aemo.com.au/) and the price Amber customers pay?
- What’s your current favourite analytics tool that you’re using at the moment and why?
Our process will generally be as follows:
- A screening interview with our talent team
- A follow up interview with our co-CEO (Chris Thompson) and CTO (John Barton)
- A take home case study for pre-read/preparation ahead of a discussion with our Engineering Manager (Mat Brennan) and Senior Data Analyst (Owen O'doherty)
- A final chat with our CTO (John Barton)
We promise to be respectful of your time as an applicant while trying to be as thorough as possible in finding the right fit for our team.
Applications only from candidates already based in Australia please. No recruitment firms.
“We are Common” by Common Code are assisting Amber with building their team. Any CVs will be forwarded to the "We Are Common" team.

What will your typical day look like?

As a key member of this internal facing team, you will provide data engineering, analysis, and reporting/visualisation support for a wide range of high impact and visible projects. You will engage with stakeholders at all levels to understand and execute business improvement/streamlining opportunities leveraging data and analytics.

Role Responsibilities

Involved in the full data and analytics value chain including Business Analysis, Problem Definition, and Project Scoping – you will understand, document and track business needs and requirements throughout the project life cycle, analyse requirements, create functional specifications, use-cases, and develop both business and technical process flow diagrams. You will engage decision modelling, business process mapping, and business rules management and work closely with architects and developers to understand solution options, feasibility, effort, and technical constraints.

Data Engineering and Analysis activities will involve data structure/database design, data wrangling, cleaning, and data pipeline development, ELT including automation of this function and leveraging APIs. Analysis outputs will typically involve descriptive, reporting, and visualisation with increasing exposure to applied predictive learning. Your core foundational skills in SQL Server database querying and database management incl use of SQL Server Agent will be leveraged heavily as well as tools such as Tableau and PowerBI for reporting/visualisation with DevOps/DataOps- source code management via GIT. You will also be amongst the first cohort to be trained in and use a leading data science and machine learning platform.

Predictive analytics/machine learning/AI is an area you’ve being trained in, had some exposure to, and/or delivered in the past, and you can demonstrate an interest in further development within this domain.

Job Description
Location: Melbourne | CBD
Job type: Full time
Organisation: Environment Protection Authority
Salary: $103,920 - $125,735
Occupation: Environment
Reference: VG/EPA/STRATEGY/1682997
As Victoria's environmental regulator, we set and enforce environmental standards to help ensure all Victorians can enjoy clean air, healthy waterways and pollutant-free land.
To achieve the best possible environmental outcomes for Victoria, we're increasingly shifting our focus from minimising the effects of environmental harm, to preventing it from happening in the first place.
To help us achieve this, we're now recruiting. By working at EPA you can enjoy a meaningful career with great work-life balance, while building a better future for our environment.
Senior Spatial Data Analyst
$103,920 to $125,735 salary range
Ongoing/Full Time
Hybrid working options
200 Victoria Street Carlton

About the organisation
As Victoria's environment regulator, we set and implement environmental standards to help ensure all Victorians can enjoy clean air, healthy waterways and pollutant-free land.

Benefits of working with the EPA:
Contribute to the protection of Victoria's environment and our people's health
A focus on work/life balance and development opportunities
A diverse and inclusive workplace with many career pathways
Hybrid and flexible work arrangement options

About the role
As a Senior Spatial Data Analyst within the Data Analytics and Intelligence Unit, you will support EPA's goal of becoming a preventative, targeted, risk-based regulator. You will join a dynamic team as it grows and matures, and use your advanced analytical and critical thinking skills to uncover insights to support evidence-based decision making at all levels of the organisation.

The EPA Senior Spatial Data Analyst works on researching, leading and producing advanced data analytics insights and reporting to a broad range of internal stakeholders. They collaborate internally and externally with co-regulators and other stakeholders to develop powerful regulatory insights.

Duties
Lead in the research, development and maintenance of insightful spatial and spatio-temporal analytics;
Lead the implementation of best practice advanced spatial and spatio-temporal analytics processes at EPA;
Engage with stakeholders to identify and support their advanced spatial and spatio-temporal data analysis needs.

Skills and experience
Demonstrated extensive and applied senior-level experience in spatial and spatio-temporal data science (geostatistics, spatio-temporal modelling, pattern analysis, spectral analysis) using R and/ or Python;
Demonstrated ability to present technical information to a range of stakeholders;
Demonstrated ability to lead and deliver collaborative and multidisciplinary projects within resourcing, timeline and budget parameters;
Demonstrated experience and ability to be an effective team member.

How to apply
Click the ”Apply” button to submit your resume and cover letter. Applications close 8 January.
EPA encourages applications from First Nations Australians and people from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
Please contact recruitment.mailbox@epa.vic.gov.au should you require this ad in an accessible format.
All queries in relation to this role should be directed to Dr Maj-Britt di Folco, Lead Data Analyst, Data Analytics and Intelligence: Maj-Britt.diFolco@epa.vic.gov.au.
Please note:
Preferred candidates will be required to submit proof of compliance with EPA's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy (two doses of COVID-19 vaccine plus at least one booster dose).
You must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident (for ongoing roles) or hold a valid work permit or visa.
Preferred candidates will be subject to pre-employment checks including, but not limited to, police checks, reference checks and role related security clearances.

Good call. We’re an exciting new digital enterprise with big ideas, supporting some of Australia’s most trusted and iconic brands focussed on making lives better for people all around Australia. We’re well on our way towards bringing the best of digital and data possibilities together to create more personalised shopping experiences for customers across our retail brands. Why? Because we want to make life more effortless for all Australians.
We’re continuing to bring the best talent and skills under one roof, working together and across disciplines to build amazing experiences for our customers. We continuously feed off each other’s insights, talents and capabilities, because we are a business that thrives on open collaboration and a shared vision of positive, fun and rewarding experiences.
In this role, you'll get to
Identify the key actionable insights through the analysis of data and translate this into clear business relevant recommendations and presentations.
Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics-based decision making.
Apply appropriate analytical methods and techniques in an agile, pragmatic way that reflects the needs, constraints and KPIs of the business (e.g. time, cost, quality, data availability).
Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders and across various Leadership teams to deliver ad-hoc insights and by building repeatable reports and so the value from becoming a data driven organisation.
Contribute to the direction, development and implementation of the data and analytics strategy, roadmap and knowledge base within OneDigital and broader analytics teams within Wesfarmers divisions.
Relationship & KPIs
Collaborate with stakeholders in Analytics, Digital / Ecommerce, Marketing, Commercial, Technology, Data Engineering and Data Science teams to deliver valuable solutions to key business problems.
Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders to improve their understanding and knowledge of analytical techniques and outcomes.
Effective communication with key stakeholders around the delivery of key projects.
Delivery
Design and implement new analytics solutions, to meet business needs.
Innovation
Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.
To shine on day one, what you need to have:
Analytics professional with a proven track record (1-2 years) in the development and business use of digital analytics technology and working with large & complex data sets.
Track record in designing and delivering data driven and/or analytics solutions that are actionable.
Proficiency in SQL and digital analytics (e.g. Google BigQuery, Tealium).
Ability to engage and influence business users in the opportunity and benefit from data driven decisions.
It's a bonus, but not required, if you have:
Experience with BI visualisation tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau).
Experience with Python.
Experience in big data analytics and technology.
Proficiency in DAX and Power Query.
Familiarity with web architecture including tag management, data layers, analytics tracking, and corresponding data flows.
Why OneDigital?
Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things.
You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life.
Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam
Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed.
We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.
Team Benefits – just to name a few!
To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include:
Access to the latest technologies.
An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more).
Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days.
Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly
People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small
Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.
Next steps
If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date. For brief enquiries please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner at sprasad@wesdigital.com.au

Why AE Capital?
AE Capital is focused on forecasting the future. Our approach is scientific and combines the power of human expertise with machine learning to create algorithms that predict the world’s financial markets. As with complex problems like weather forecasting, the best forecasts come from humans interacting with the computer models and we have been developing a similar philosophy in finance for over 10 years.

AE Capital is one of the few businesses in the world to have successfully used machine learning in finance, and our commitment to continuous improvement in all that we do has led to another recent breakthrough. We have developed a framework that allows traditional “discretionary” traders to create algorithmic trading models, without the need for programming experience. Secondly, we have created specialised data sets that allow machine learning experts to apply their trade without the need for deep financial expertise.

We now need talented individuals who can bring their expertise and domain knowledge - whether it be in financial markets, data science, computer science, software engineering or infrastructure - and apply their skills to our new methodology as we grow.

We are always on the lookout for self-motivated, results-driven analytical minds who enjoy problem solving and can bring their skills and experience to our team. This is a unique opportunity to learn from industry leaders in our collaborative and hands-on environment, pushing the boundaries of finance and technology.

Enjoy the many benefits of working for AE Capital, at our offices in Melbourne, one of the world’s most liveable cities. With flexible work hours, genuine autonomy, and the ability to have a direct impact on the business, our unique culture embodies the Aussie spirit of mateship, teamwork, and the open exchange of ideas in a fun, dynamic and informal environment.
What we look for
Nearly everything we do at AE Capital is unique and different which results in our world leading outcomes. The continued success of this requires teamwork, strong problem-solving skills, great communication and lots of (dead-end) experimentation.

So, when ploughing through these tough problems, we want to work with likeminded people who
are passionate and excited about what they do
are loyal and honest to each other
are hard working
have a thirst for knowledge and try to solve one’s own problems
focus on the detail and correctness of their work
and are dedicated to get the job done
because this, above all else, will determine our continued, mutual success.
The job

As a Quantitative Analyst you will use your expertise in computer modelling to work with our traders and contribute to the design and development of our predictive models, that our quantitative developers and software engineers then bring to life.

We are a “Bayesian” firm that values intuitive priors and empirical inference to identify and prove a theory or relationship. We are not afraid to explore new ideas and being "applied academics” at the core, we will encourage theoretical and practical pursuits in data science, machine learning, stochastic processes, optimization, signal processing and control systems, to name a few. Financial markets are truly the most humbling of all predictive systems and the optimal place to test and hone your skills.

We are a small and agile company that will provide you with the ability to engage and work across all areas of the business and collaborate with all your colleagues to collectively design and build solutions that result in measurable, positive outcomes.

About You:

You will need to be articulate, intelligent, naturally inquisitive, and thrive in environments that encourage new ideas and value thought leadership.

You will need to be able to demonstrate:
A strong academic foundation with a passion for truth and the scientific method
A high-level of initiative and self-motivation.
Excellent coding skills and deep experience with big data sets (Matlab, Python, C, Fortran, or similar).
Ideally you will be comfortable in a Unix environment with knowledge of cluster computing.
A willingness to further develop and specialize your skills including the knowledge of financial markets if you are new to the industry.
Your background
Masters or PhD in Physics, Atmospheric Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or an equivalent discipline
Exposure to financial markets and software development will be advantageous but not essential for the right person.

We are happy to consider entry level and experienced applicants. If you are accountable, professional, enjoy a collaborative high achieving team environment and want to work with some of the brightest and best in the business, all you need to do is send us your CV and Cover letter. We’ll invite you to undertake a few quick online assessments and then be in touch.

In return we will provide you with a work environment and opportunity that will enable you to thrive, be heard and be valued; plus be very well compensated.

The AE Capital talent team do not require recruitment agency support, we have this covered.

GroupM is the leading global media investment management company serving as the parent to WPP media agencies including Mindshare, Wavemaker and Essence MediaCom, as well as the programmatic digital media platform, Xaxis, each global operation in their own right with leading market positions. With 800+ people based in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide and Brisbane, GroupM’s primary purpose is to maximize performance of WPP’s media agencies by operating as leader and collaborator in trading, content creation, sports, digital, finance, proprietary tool development and other business-critical capabilities. GroupM’s focus is to deliver unrivalled marketplace advantage to its clients, stakeholders and people.
The Data & Tech team at GroupM always have their finger on the pulse, market trends, customer insights and the most up to date know-how on all things data & technology with respect to advertising and identity. The team leverage these skills and attributes to provide A+ service and leadership to our agency partners and client leads.

YOUR ROLE IN A NUTSHELL:
Data Engineering at GroupM is about supporting the development and deployment of GroupM products and services across multiple cloud environments & platforms. The Data Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams of client leads, product leads, consultants and data analyst to translate complex product requirements into technical specs and design requirements. You will build pipelines, optimize performance and build automated solutions whilst maintaining a high degree of knowledge in cloud data architecture and ETL best practices especially across Google Cloud Platform products and services.
You will be responsible for bringing together data, creativity and multiple methods to help our stakeholders make better choices rooted in human insights. All our people, processes and technology are united through our focus on understanding, accelerating and optimizing the current offerings, making them more satisfying for stakeholders and more effective for our clients.

REPORTING OF THE ROLE:
Data Science & Technology Automation, Director

WHAT YOU SHOULD SPEND YOUR TIME DOING:
In order for the business to work, you will be required to spend time in certain areas of the business and make sure your stakeholders are aligned. In addition, you will be the subject matter on all things Data Engineering & Analysis in the Data & Tech team. Your key responsibilities are as follows:
Product
Develop new processes and applications to automate repetitive tasks
Support the Data & Tech team in building custom solutions, delivering key projects and BAU operations, with respect to data engineering, analysis and models.
Design, build and deploy business intelligence dashboards and reporting solutions that increase efficiencies in reporting requirements
Build data pipes landing large files into GCP/AWS for processing, developing/ cleansing data for reporting, automation & AI/ML purposes.
Implement ETL data processing procedures where applicable
Monitor infrastructure performance and optimise where necessary
Performing regular data health checks to ensure data quality and completeness is adhered
Ensure all works are being done in line with company and industry compliance standards
Working on multiple projects involving various stages of the product life cycle
Participate in R&D of projects and contribute to the innovation of new methods (Data Architecture, data profiling tools, ETL and data management tools etc.)

Partnership
Liaising with third party vendors, platforms and outsourcing partners, as appropriate for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Collaboration with external technology vendors e.g., publishers, DSPs, SSP’s, ad tech vendors etc for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Interface and knowledge transfer between Commercial, Ops, Product and Analytics departments
When required, collaborate with any regional and APAC WPP counterparts for economies of scale, knowledge share and any relevant technical streams

People
Demonstrate good communication & presentation skills across all facets of your work
Respond well to guidance and feedback from internal & external stakeholders
Work collaboratively with Data & tech team members and wider GroupM teams

Performance
Ensure discretion and prioritisation is given to either supporting 100% commercial initiatives and/or time saving initiatives
Work collaboratively with stakeholders in ensuring complex technical solutions are demystified and clearly understood
Effectively and succinctly communicate risks in a timely manner, where applicable with suggested mitigation plan
Deliver technical products and solutions on time, and within specification agreed upon by stakeholders involved
Ensure a sound, reliable, ethical and robust governance framework is functioning effectively in line with WPP/GroupM policies and compliance requirements

WHAT IT TAKES
Degree in a relevant field (Statistics/ Mathematics/Computer Science/Economics/Data Analytics)
Previous experience in an engineering/analytical role (0-3yrs), ideally within AdTech/Martech but not mandatory
A hunger to learn and specialise your skillset with an amazing team
Flexibility to work in a cross-functional team but also have the initiative to solve the problem independently
Initiative is key, this role will need a “let me figure this out” attitude rather than “tell me what to do attitude”
Hands on experience in integrating multiple technologies to bring products to life
Ability to balance deadlines with an eye for detail and passion for quality

EXPERIENCE:
The Data Engineer will support the Data & Tech team for all things Data Engineering. They will have exceptional interpersonal skills, being able to communicate complex issues in an easy to digest format. In addition, have strong business acumen & technical skills to ensure GroupM retains and improves its competitive advantage when it comes to data, technology & automation.

COMPETENCIES:
Mastery with Python to work with big data
Strong expertise with Data Architecture fundamentals, database design and programming, ETL and custom query development.
Experience with the following GCP Services: Cloud Storage, DataProc, Dataflow, CloudSQL, BigQuery, Cloud Functions.
A strong understanding of database structures and data mining, being proficient with SQL across multiple database platforms (MySQL, SQL Server etc)
Experience in utilising a version control system (GIT/TFS) and project tracking system (Jira/AzureDevOps)
Proficient with project and product management delivery methodologies and software e.g. JIRA, confluence, Microsoft Project, Asana etc
Strong expertise of BI platforms (DataStudio/Tableau/Datorama/Power BI)
Experience working with API’s

The Department of Transport brings together all transport modes to design, plan, build and operate Victoria's transport system. Our job is to further integrate the transport network and improve the delivery of services to Victorians for simpler, quicker and safer journeys that connect people and places and support Victoria's prosperity and liveability. We are excited to offer this opportunity for you to become part of the Department that delivers more choice, connections and confidence in our travel, ensuring the whole transport network works as one to deliver better services and outcomes.
An exciting 24mth opportunity has presented with someone with spatial, mapping and GIS experience to join the Network Data and Systems team, the team is responsible for integration of data and applications, enabling and contributing to delivery of enhanced business and customer value across asset management, safety and location referencing services.
As the Data System Consultant you will support the delivery of spatial solutions. You will be responsible for the design and development of spatial data and location referencing solutions.
Spatial Data Systems Consultant
Annual Salary Range: $90,067 - $102,192 per annum plus superannuation
Employment Type: Full Time, Fixed Term - 24mths

Reporting to the Location Referencing Lead and working closely with the broader Mobility and Insights team, you will drive outcomes of high value to the community and the business. This position requires a tertiary qualification in information systems or computer science, along with extensive knowledge of spatial products and tools.

Spatial, mapping and GIS experience

Culture and Benefits
The Department of Transport is committed to building a culture of developing our people to achieve great outcomes for the Victorian transport network. We are proud of our commitment to flexible work arrangements that support different ways of working, helping employees balance work and life. We are focused on providing a workplace environment that is rewarding, enjoyable, healthy and productive for all employees, where contributions are valued and recognised, expectations are clear, and treatment is fair and equitable.
DoT is committed to inclusive recruitment with our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women and gender diverse people, the LGBTIQ+ community, people living with disabilities and those from Culturally and Linguistically diverse communities. That's why we encourage people in these groups to apply, even if you don't meet every single requirement, or your skills don't perfectly align. How to Apply

About us
WSP is one of the world's leading engineering professional services consulting firms, bringing together approximately 64,000 talented people around the globe. We are technical experts who design and provide strategic advice on sustainable solutions and engineer Future Ready projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come.

The Opportunity
WSP Digital is the digital consulting and solutions division of WSP. We are global innovators and leaders in the integrated development and use of software to enhance our customer's engineering, infrastructure, building, and environmental projects
We have exciting opportunities for Senior Data Scientists to grow our team anywhere across Australia.
You will be responsible for identifying, prioritising, and solving complex engineering business problems by developing advanced statistical and analytical modelling techniques, including Machine Learning.

What will you be doing?
You'll be working with a range of government and commercial clients to enhance the operation and maintenance of many critical infrastructure systems that keep our world spinning.
Many of our clients operate large-scale, network-based systems such as road, rail, and water supply networks, with tangible outcomes that affect us all.
Work with clients to understand their needs and devise novel solutions
Collaborate with other engineering and digital disciplines, such as Digital engineering and Location Intelligence, to deliver complex multi-disciplinary projects across various engineering fields.
Anticipating, characterising, and managing complex real-world data's limitations and implications. Conceiving effective workarounds or alternative mitigations to deliver successful outcomes.
Gain experience in taking corrective action and making tough decisions to recover or successfully implement projects
Work with massive and complex data sets from multiple sources, utilising big data tools and techniques to analyse, provide insight and validate hypotheses.
Perform deep-dive analyses of experiments through reliable modelling methods that include numerous explanatory variables and covariates.
Translating analytical insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business, process, or product improvements.
Making recommendations for the collection of new data or the refinement of existing data sources and storage.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to deliver and solve real-world engineering problems with ML and data science.
Collaborate across the business to influence change and bring ideas to life.
Create solutions that will benefit the wider community.
Contribute to creating a more sustainable future.

What we'll love about you
6+ years experience in a data science environment (experience may be a mix of corporate, industry research, government or academic)
Ability to ideate and set vision and scope for complex data-driven projects, including a deep understanding of client value-proposition and stakeholder needs
Understanding of core data science, machine learning and statistical concepts and methods
Ability to manipulate and analyse complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data and metadata from varying sources.
Passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
Proven history of successful client adoption and/or operationalisation of analytical and statistical tools
Expert knowledge of analytical tools and cloud data services
Demonstrated knowledge of relational/structured data manipulation, machine learning, and scientific statistical analysis.
Solid understanding and experience with software engineering practice & principles.
Preference for Python based software development experience

What we will offer you
At WSP, we provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many personal and professional development opportunities to help you deliver your best self to the role whilst balancing your personal life. We have been recognised for the second consecutive year as a Great Place to Work® with year-on-year increases in employee engagement.
Some of the many benefits we offer our employees include:
Flexible working hours and working from home
Global mobility
Parental leave & purchased additional annual leave
Corporate employee discounts and offers
Salary continuance insurance
Wellness at work & social club
Workplace giving /volunteering
Employee reward & recognition program
Professional and technical development opportunities

Inspired by Diversity, Driven by Inclusion…
Discover a forward-thinking culture that incorporates some conventional yet non-negotiable qualities—like respect, integrity, and trust. We welcome all perspectives, strengths, skills, creeds, and genders to the table because we know that diverse ideas breed extraordinary results.
If you think you have what it takes but don't meet all criteria, please still get in touch. We would love to chat and see if we can find a fit.

Job Title

Job Summary
The Network Engineering-Senior Engineer is a critical contributor in ensuring that the Telstra network delivers a superior network experience for our consumer and business customers. You do this by drawing on your deep levels of telecommunications network expertise and experience to provide specialist analysis, design, development and deployment in network specific technology domains, including developing platform specific technology roadmaps and making technology investment recommendations.
Job Description
At Telstra, our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. It's a future that won't happen on its own, it has to be delivered — and only Telstra can bring together all the parts to create it. And, this is where YOU come in, by playing your part in help our customers connect: faster, better and smarter.
The role with us
The Senior Developer role will be develop business logic, data management and systems integration services to enable customer end users to manage their network product planning, configuration, deployment and operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, build, install, integrate and maintain software and integrations which implement product logic and processes to support customer, partner and Telstra employee control of complex network technologies and platforms for fixed network provisioning and operations
Translate customer (internal, external or regulatory) needs and requirements, using technical principles into reusable API based micro-services, data models, workflows, and integrations
Negotiate and agree on frontend and peer system integration API specifications to implement required user experience and end-to-end processes
Work with Product Owners and Technical Product Owners to develop business and technology roadmaps
Utilise on-premises and cloud technologies to deploy and host applications
Accountable for Backend Micro-Services, using Java
Use existing code repositories and CICD pipelines to deploy into development and production environments
Utilising Agile ceremonies and practices, lead planning, design and estimation sessions.
Integrate solutions by executing on security and operational requirements
Assess capability of third party and open source libraries and tools to meet business requirements and manage software supply chain delivery
Assess capability of internal libraries, tools, APIs and systems and offerings to meet business requirements
Develop platform-specific technology functionality for business requirements that leverage opportunities from evolving and future technologies
Participate in a DevOps and DevSecOps environment and team.
About you
To be successful in the role, you need to have:
Essential
A Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or similar discipline.
Typically, a minimum of 5-10 years’ experience working in an Operational and/or Software Engineering role and have expertise with a variety of deployment, automation, configuration management and optimisation tools.
Strong experience in one (or more) of the following technologies:
Java
JavaScript
Java Springboot
NodeJS
Python
Exposure to network automation, Software Defined Networking and NFVi concepts and technology
Proven programming experience that conforms to good software engineering design principles and practices (including version management). This includes experience with API integration.
Practical experience with Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines. Enhancing and improving CI/CD capabilities to reduce cycle time while retaining quality
Experience designing and implementing Infrastructure-as-Code, such as Terraform
Experience in delivering projects as part of an agile team and exposure to DevOps teams, practices and tools
Willingness to learn new technologies and keen to drive innovation
Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving and time management skills
Strong interpersonal and consultative skills
Strong desire to learn and drive skills to expert level in the domain
Proactive and self-motivated

Description & Requirements
About the role:

The Translator converts business needs into advanced analytics (AA) language and outcomes of Digital into business implications. Responsibilities
Articulates analytics proposition to business stakeholders & conducts diagnostics to identify use case opportunities

Leads communication of analytics outputs with executives; acts as bridge between management & analytics specialists; Shares insights with business stakeholders and collects inputs to verify and iterate analytics results
Guides analytics team to develop right visualizations for presenting results
About you
Hands-on experience translating business requirements into functional specifications that Data Engineers and other technical resources can act on.
Familiarity with managing and/or developing analytic designs that enable complex multi-functional views of data to support critical business decisions
Quantitative background: Engineering- Statistics- Mathematics- Sciences- Finance
Familiarity with engineering- analytics- UX- and Agile preferred
Experience as a Product Owner / Product Manager with software / analytics products
Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex technical concepts and align organization on decisions
Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging / disruptive technologies
Agile experience- especially in managing multi-functional teams within the org

We empower our people to own their work- and it’s true our employees are our competitive advantage – so we take care of our Kraft Heinz family with our ‘Live Well’ benefits program:

About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

We are seeking a Software Engineer for a contract until 30/6/2023. The Data Engineer role is responsible for managing and optimising the data pipeline to support quality data outcomes. The focus of this role will be to support delivery of digital planning reform initiatives.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities for this engagement are primarily:
Build resilient, secure high-performance infrastructure required for optimal ETL/ELT processes from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, Azure and AWS 'data lake' technologies.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.
Contribute to building analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into the planning system performance.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product and Data teams to resolve data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Collaborate with data and analytics experts to deliver greater functionality in our data systems.
Work flexibly and collaboratively across the business to deliver business unit, group and DELWP priorities and initiatives as required.

Experience with data warehouses, data lakes and ETL/ELT tool chains
Capabilities
Stakeholder Management
Identifies and manages a range of complex and often competing needs. Identifies issues in common for one or more stakeholders and uses them to build mutually beneficial partnerships.
Finds innovative solutions to resolve stakeholder issues.

Formulates potential courses of action to achieve objectives based on an in-depth understanding of the business environment and its systems.

GroupM is the leading global media investment management company serving as the parent to WPP media agencies including Mindshare, Wavemaker and Essence MediaCom, as well as the programmatic digital media platform, Xaxis, each global operation in their own right with leading market positions. With 800+ people based in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide and Brisbane, GroupM’s primary purpose is to maximize performance of WPP’s media agencies by operating as leader and collaborator in trading, content creation, sports, digital, finance, proprietary tool development and other business-critical capabilities. GroupM’s focus is to deliver unrivalled marketplace advantage to its clients, stakeholders and people.
The Data & Tech team at GroupM always have their finger on the pulse, market trends, customer insights and the most up to date know-how on all things data & technology with respect to advertising and identity. The team leverage these skills and attributes to provide A+ service and leadership to our agency partners and client leads.

YOUR ROLE IN A NUTSHELL:
Data Engineering at GroupM is about supporting the development and deployment of GroupM products and services across multiple cloud environments & platforms. The Data Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams of client leads, product leads, consultants and data analyst to translate complex product requirements into technical specs and design requirements. You will build pipelines, optimize performance and build automated solutions whilst maintaining a high degree of knowledge in cloud data architecture and ETL best practices especially across Google Cloud Platform products and services.
You will be responsible for bringing together data, creativity and multiple methods to help our stakeholders make better choices rooted in human insights. All our people, processes and technology are united through our focus on understanding, accelerating and optimizing the current offerings, making them more satisfying for stakeholders and more effective for our clients.

REPORTING OF THE ROLE:
Data Science & Technology Automation, Director

WHAT YOU SHOULD SPEND YOUR TIME DOING:
In order for the business to work, you will be required to spend time in certain areas of the business and make sure your stakeholders are aligned. In addition, you will be the subject matter on all things Data Engineering & Analysis in the Data & Tech team. Your key responsibilities are as follows:
Product
Develop new processes and applications to automate repetitive tasks
Support the Data & Tech team in building custom solutions, delivering key projects and BAU operations, with respect to data engineering, analysis and models.
Design, build and deploy business intelligence dashboards and reporting solutions that increase efficiencies in reporting requirements
Build data pipes landing large files into GCP/AWS for processing, developing/ cleansing data for reporting, automation & AI/ML purposes.
Implement ETL data processing procedures where applicable
Monitor infrastructure performance and optimise where necessary
Performing regular data health checks to ensure data quality and completeness is adhered
Ensure all works are being done in line with company and industry compliance standards
Working on multiple projects involving various stages of the product life cycle
Participate in R&D of projects and contribute to the innovation of new methods (Data Architecture, data profiling tools, ETL and data management tools etc.)

Partnership
Liaising with third party vendors, platforms and outsourcing partners, as appropriate for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Collaboration with external technology vendors e.g., publishers, DSPs, SSP’s, ad tech vendors etc for delivery of solutions within area of responsibility
Interface and knowledge transfer between Commercial, Ops, Product and Analytics departments
When required, collaborate with any regional and APAC WPP counterparts for economies of scale, knowledge share and any relevant technical streams

People
Demonstrate good communication & presentation skills across all facets of your work
Respond well to guidance and feedback from internal & external stakeholders
Work collaboratively with Data & tech team members and wider GroupM teams

Performance
Ensure discretion and prioritisation is given to either supporting 100% commercial initiatives and/or time saving initiatives
Work collaboratively with stakeholders in ensuring complex technical solutions are demystified and clearly understood
Effectively and succinctly communicate risks in a timely manner, where applicable with suggested mitigation plan
Deliver technical products and solutions on time, and within specification agreed upon by stakeholders involved
Ensure a sound, reliable, ethical and robust governance framework is functioning effectively in line with WPP/GroupM policies and compliance requirements

WHAT IT TAKES
Degree in a relevant field (Statistics/ Mathematics/Computer Science/Economics/Data Analytics)
Previous experience in an engineering/analytical role (0-3yrs), ideally within AdTech/Martech but not mandatory
A hunger to learn and specialise your skillset with an amazing team
Flexibility to work in a cross-functional team but also have the initiative to solve the problem independently
Initiative is key, this role will need a “let me figure this out” attitude rather than “tell me what to do attitude”
Hands on experience in integrating multiple technologies to bring products to life
Ability to balance deadlines with an eye for detail and passion for quality

EXPERIENCE:
The Data Engineer will support the Data & Tech team for all things Data Engineering. They will have exceptional interpersonal skills, being able to communicate complex issues in an easy to digest format. In addition, have strong business acumen & technical skills to ensure GroupM retains and improves its competitive advantage when it comes to data, technology & automation.

COMPETENCIES:
Mastery with Python to work with big data
Strong expertise with Data Architecture fundamentals, database design and programming, ETL and custom query development.
Experience with the following GCP Services: Cloud Storage, DataProc, Dataflow, CloudSQL, BigQuery, Cloud Functions.
A strong understanding of database structures and data mining, being proficient with SQL across multiple database platforms (MySQL, SQL Server etc)
Experience in utilising a version control system (GIT/TFS) and project tracking system (Jira/AzureDevOps)
Proficient with project and product management delivery methodologies and software e.g. JIRA, confluence, Microsoft Project, Asana etc
Strong expertise of BI platforms (DataStudio/Tableau/Datorama/Power BI)
Experience working with API’s

The Opportunity
We have a 12-month fixed-term opportunity available for a Scientist to join our Research team, based at Bio-21 Institute. As a qualified scientist you will join a high-profile research focussed, laboratory-based team that works at the interface between research and clinical development. You will support the R&D of therapeutic proteins by developing and implementing high-quality bioassay and biomarkers. You will provide important information to allow for scientifically based decisions in research, toxicology and early clinical development studies.
You will lead the scientific research from the bench, with the development of relevant new assays and assess the feasibility of biomarkers and bioassays for inclusion in research, GLP toxicology and clinical studies.
You may partner with our research colleagues from across the global research sites including Marburg in Germany and Bern in Switzerland.
Main responsibilities include:
Provide and apply well-developed scientific and technical capability in respect of bioassay and biomarker development to support research and development of novel protein based/biologic therapies
Maintain awareness of new scientific/technical strategies in the area of bioassay and biomarker development
Assess novel target specific bioassays via literature reviews and experimental screening to determine relevance and suitability to address program goals.
Attend, participate and present at research group meetings/reviews
Ensure documentation and recording of all laboratory notes and research on projects is up-to-date, secure and accessible in accordance to Laboratory Notebook guidelines
Prepare clear standard operating procedures, validation protocols and scientific reports.
Collaborate with the supervising Senior and Research Scientists in planning and carrying out experimental work relevant to project specific goals
To be successful:
You will have tertiary qualifications in Science along with laboratory experience, with at least 3 years experience in pre-clinical and clinical development of biopharmaceuticals or equivalent related experience in industry or academic environments.
You can undertake novel approaches to basic scientific questions independently and part of a team
You have hands-on assay development experience of novel and bespoke biomarkers using analytical techniques such as ligand-binding assays (ELISA, MSD, bead arrays, multiplex), enzymatic assays and cell-based assays.
You will have excellent communication skills and be able to grasp complex problems, identify solutions and make data-driven recommendations to support programs.
Experience working with scientific graphics programmes.

About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!

You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

23 Dec 2022 11:59pm
Job Title
Senior Developer
Job Summary
The Network Engineering-Senior Engineer is a critical contributor in ensuring that the Telstra network delivers a superior network experience for our consumer and business customers. You do this by drawing on your deep levels of telecommunications network expertise and experience to provide specialist analysis, design, development and deployment in network specific technology domains, including developing platform specific technology roadmaps and making technology investment recommendations.
Job Description
At Telstra, our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. It's a future that won't happen on its own, it has to be delivered — and only Telstra can bring together all the parts to create it. And, this is where YOU come in, by playing your part in help our customers connect: faster, better and smarter.
The role with us
The Senior Developer role will be develop business logic, data management and systems integration services to enable customer end users to manage their network product planning, configuration, deployment and operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, build, install, integrate and maintain software and integrations which implement product logic and processes to support customer, partner and Telstra employee control of complex network technologies and platforms for fixed network provisioning and operations
Translate customer (internal, external or regulatory) needs and requirements, using technical principles into reusable API based micro-services, data models, workflows, and integrations
Negotiate and agree on frontend and peer system integration API specifications to implement required user experience and end-to-end processes
Work with Product Owners and Technical Product Owners to develop business and technology roadmaps
Utilise on-premises and cloud technologies to deploy and host applications
Accountable for Backend Micro-Services, using Java
Use existing code repositories and CICD pipelines to deploy into development and production environments
Utilising Agile ceremonies and practices, lead planning, design and estimation sessions.
Integrate solutions by executing on security and operational requirements
Assess capability of third party and open source libraries and tools to meet business requirements and manage software supply chain delivery
Assess capability of internal libraries, tools, APIs and systems and offerings to meet business requirements
Develop platform-specific technology functionality for business requirements that leverage opportunities from evolving and future technologies
Participate in a DevOps and DevSecOps environment and team.
About you
To be successful in the role, you need to have:
Essential
A Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or similar discipline.
Typically, a minimum of 5-10 years’ experience working in an Operational and/or Software Engineering role and have expertise with a variety of deployment, automation, configuration management and optimisation tools.
Strong experience in one (or more) of the following technologies:
Java
JavaScript
Java Springboot
NodeJS
Python
Exposure to network automation, Software Defined Networking and NFVi concepts and technology
Proven programming experience that conforms to good software engineering design principles and practices (including version management). This includes experience with API integration.
Practical experience with Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines. Enhancing and improving CI/CD capabilities to reduce cycle time while retaining quality
Experience designing and implementing Infrastructure-as-Code, such as Terraform
Experience in delivering projects as part of an agile team and exposure to DevOps teams, practices and tools
Willingness to learn new technologies and keen to drive innovation
Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving and time management skills
Strong interpersonal and consultative skills
Strong desire to learn and drive skills to expert level in the domain
Proactive and self-motivated
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!

Dynamic sales role within the J&J Vision Care business in Victoria
Great Place to Work® Certified - 2022

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Johnson & Johnson Vision is a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. We are a leading global optical company that is relentless in our pursuit to help people honor their eyes across their entire lives. Innovation is at the heart of our organization and embedded in all we do. It fuels our discovery and development of new products and extends to our collaborations, education and community efforts to bring new solutions to those in need.
Since debuting the world’s first disposable soft contact lens in 1987, it has been helping patients see better through their world-leading ACUVUE® Contact Lenses. Additionally, in 2017, J&J expanded even further into cataract surgery, laser refractive surgery and consumer eye health and now serves more than 60 million patients a day across 103 countries with its eye health portfolio.
THE OPPORTUNITY
We have an exciting opportunity for a Customer Development Manager to join our J&J Vision Care team based in Melbourne covering the Victoria territory.
Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager you’ll have the opportunity to work across our full suite of products within the Vision Care range, bringing the ACUVUE® brands to life with Eye Care Professionals and their teams.
In this role, you will play an instrumental role in driving sales performance by developing and maintaining trusted professional relationships with eyecare professionals throughout Victoria. You will be part of a high performing team and overseeing a territory with a strong reputation and market share.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Be a product specialist; represent J&J Vision Care by interacting with existing customers and developing new prospects to gain their commitment on ACUVUE® Brand Contact Lenses and the Vision Care product portfolio
Develop and maintain close relationships with eyecare professionals (i.e. optometrists, orthoptists, practice owners) and their support team through calling on Optometry practices and ensuring their clinical and business requirements are being met by the company
Uncover customers’ strategic priorities, buying motives, end user needs, office processes, and business operations across segments while demonstrating the ability to gain order, product commitment and growth opportunities
Work collaboratively with your team, Sales Manager and support office colleagues to develop long-term sales strategies for the territory and maximize success
Manage data to develop strategic territory plans that showcase your ability to take ownership of your territory and write your own success
Conduct regular CRM maintenance (salesforce.com), revenue/diagnostic inventory management, manage orders, returns & exchanges and enquiries
Liaise with key professional organizations and be a champion for customer service and patient care
Qualifications
ITS ALL ABOUT YOU
Bachelor’s degree in Orthoptics, Optometry, Health Sciences, Business, or related disciplines
Optometry or Ophthalmology experience is highly desirable
Prior commercial experience with a clinical background is advantageous; strong understanding of the sales cycle and demonstrated experience of building strong customer relationships
Ability to influence with strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
A clear, creative, and accountable nature; striving to be successful with a positive mindset
Collaborative, organized and take pride in making a difference
Able to travel as needed (10% to 15%) with a valid driver’s license
COMPANY CULTURE
You will be rewarded through a competitive remuneration package along with continuous training, support and award-winning leadership development programs.

Be a product specialist; represent J&J Vision Care by interacting with existing customers and developing new prospects to gain their commitment on ACUVUE® Brand Contact Lenses and the Vision Care product portfolio
Develop and maintain close relationships with eyecare professionals (i.e. optometrists, orthoptists, practice owners) and their support team through calling on Optometry practices and ensuring their clinical and business requirements are being met by the company
Uncover customers’ strategic priorities, buying motives, end user needs, office processes, and business operations across segments while demonstrating the ability to gain order, product commitment and growth opportunities
Work collaboratively with your team, Sales Manager and support office colleagues to develop long-term sales strategies for the territory and maximize success
Manage data to develop strategic territory plans that showcase your ability to take ownership of your territory and write your own success
Conduct regular CRM maintenance (salesforce.com), revenue/diagnostic inventory management, manage orders, returns & exchanges and enquiries
Liaise with key professional organizations and be a champion for customer service and patient care
Qualifications
ITS ALL ABOUT YOU
Bachelor’s degree in Orthoptics, Optometry, Health Sciences, Business, or related disciplines
Optometry or Ophthalmology experience is highly desirable
Prior commercial experience with a clinical background is advantageous; strong understanding of the sales cycle and demonstrated experience of building strong customer relationships
Ability to influence with strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
A clear, creative, and accountable nature; striving to be successful with a positive mindset
Collaborative, organized and take pride in making a difference
Able to travel as needed (10% to 15%) with a valid driver’s license
COMPANY CULTURE
You will be rewarded through a competitive remuneration package along with continuous training, support and award-winning leadership development programs.
